question: AWS allows users to manage their resources using a web based user interface. What is the name of this interface?
explanation: The AWS Management Console is the web-based graphical interface used to manage and interact with AWS resources directly from a browser.

question: Which of the following is an example of horizontal scaling in the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Replacing an existing EC2 instance with a larger, more powerful one.
options.B: Increasing the compute capacity of a single EC2 instance to address the growing demands of an application.
options.C: Adding more RAM capacity to an EC2 instance.
options.D: Adding more EC2 instances of the same size to handle an increase in traffic.

explanation: Horizontal scaling means adding more instances of the same size to distribute load, rather than making a single instance bigger (which is vertical scaling).

question: You have noticed that several critical Amazon EC2 instances have been terminated. Which of the following AWS services would help you determine who took this action?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail records all API calls and account activity, making it the go-to service for auditing who performed actions like terminating EC2 instances.

question: Which of the below options are related to the reliability of AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Applying the principle of least privilege to all AWS resources.
options.B: Automatically provisioning new resources to meet demand.
options.C: All AWS services are considered Global Services, and this design helps customers serve their international users.
options.D: Providing compensation to customers if issues occur.
options.E: Ability to recover quickly from failures.

explanation: Reliability in AWS is built on automatically provisioning resources to meet demand and the ability to recover quickly from failures — both ensure the system keeps running under varying conditions.

question: Which statement is true regarding the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?

options.A: Responsibilities vary depending on the services used.
options.B: Security of the IaaS services is the responsibility of AWS.
options.C: Patching the guest OS is always the responsibility of AWS.
options.D: Security of the managed services is the responsibility of the customer.

explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, who is responsible for what shifts depending on the service type — for managed services AWS takes on more, while for IaaS the customer handles more of the stack.

question: You have set up consolidated billing for several AWS accounts. One of the accounts has purchased a number of reserved instances for 3 years. Which of the following is true regarding this scenario?

options.A: The Reserved Instance discounts can only be shared with the master account.
options.B: All accounts can receive the hourly cost benefit of the Reserved Instances.
options.C: The purchased instances will have better performance than On-demand instances.
options.D: There are no cost benefits from using consolidated billing; It is for informational purposes only.

explanation: With consolidated billing, Reserved Instance discounts are automatically shared across all accounts in the organization, so any account can benefit from the hourly cost savings.

question: A company has developed an eCommerce web application in AWS. What should they do to ensure that the application has the highest level of availability?

options.A: Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones and Edge locations.
options.B: Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones and subnets.
options.C: Deploy the application across multiple Regions and Availability Zones.
options.D: Deploy the application across multiple VPC’s and subnets.

explanation: Deploying across multiple Regions and Availability Zones gives the highest availability by protecting against both AZ-level and Region-level failures.

question: What does AWS Snowball provide? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Built-in computing capabilities that allow customers to process data locally.
options.B: A catalog of third-party software solutions that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses.
options.C: A hybrid cloud storage between on-premises environments and the AWS Cloud.
options.D: An Exabyte-scale data transfer service that allows you to move extremely large amounts of data to AWS.
options.E: Secure transfer of large amounts of data into and out of the AWS.

explanation: AWS Snowball Edge includes built-in compute capabilities for local data processing, and securely transfers large amounts of data into and out of AWS — making it both a compute and data transfer appliance.

question: A company has an AWS Enterprise Support plan. They want quick and efficient guidance with their billing and account inquiries. Which of the following should the company use?
explanation: The AWS Support Concierge, available on the Enterprise plan, is a dedicated team specifically for billing and account inquiries, providing fast and personalized assistance.

question: A Japanese company hosts their applications on Amazon EC2 instances in the Tokyo Region. The company has opened new branches in the United States, and the US users are complaining of high latency. What can the company do to reduce latency for the users in the US while minimizing costs?

options.A: Applying the Amazon Connect latency-based routing policy.
options.B: Registering a new US domain name to serve the users in the US.
options.C: Building a new data center in the US and implementing a hybrid model.
options.D: Deploying new Amazon EC2 instances in a Region located in the US.

explanation: Deploying EC2 instances in a US Region places compute resources physically closer to US users, directly reducing network latency at minimal additional cost.

question: An organization has a large number of technical employees who operate their AWS Cloud infrastructure. What does AWS provide to help organize them into teams and then assign the appropriate permissions for each team?
explanation: IAM user groups let you group multiple users together and assign permissions once at the group level, making it easy to manage access for teams without configuring each user individually.

question: A company has decided to migrate its Oracle database to AWS. Which AWS service can help achieve this without negatively impacting the functionality of the source database?
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) is purpose-built for migrating databases to AWS with minimal downtime, keeping the source database fully operational throughout the migration.

question: Adjusting compute capacity dynamically to reduce cost is an implementation of which AWS cloud best practice?
explanation: Elasticity is the cloud practice of dynamically scaling compute capacity up or down based on demand, which avoids over-provisioning and reduces costs.

question: What are the benefits of having infrastructure hosted in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.B: There is no need to worry about security.
options.C: Gaining complete control over the physical infrastructure.
options.D: Operating applications on behalf of customers.
options.E: All of the physical security and most of the data/network security are taken care of for you.

explanation: AWS increases speed and agility by letting you provision resources in minutes, and handles physical security and most data/network security, so you can focus on building rather than infrastructure management.

question: What is the advantage of the AWS-recommended practice of "decoupling" applications?

options.A: Allows treating an application as a single, cohesive unit.
options.B: Reduces inter-dependencies so that failures do not impact other components of the application.
options.C: Allows updates of any monolithic application quickly and easily.
options.D: Allows tracking of any API call made to any AWS service.

explanation: Decoupling means designing components to operate independently, so a failure in one part does not cascade into failures across the rest of the application.

question: Which of the following helps a customer view the Amazon EC2 billing activity for the past month?
explanation: AWS Cost & Usage Reports provide the most detailed and comprehensive breakdown of actual AWS spending, including EC2 billing activity, by time period and resource.

question: What do you gain from setting up consolidated billing for five different AWS accounts under another master account?

options.A: AWS services’ costs will be reduced to half the original price.
options.B: The consolidated billing feature is just for organizational purpose.
options.C: Each AWS account gets volume discounts.
options.D: Each AWS account gets five times the free-tier services capacity.

explanation: Consolidated billing aggregates usage across all accounts, which can push the combined usage into higher volume tiers and unlock volume discounts that individual accounts would not reach on their own.

question: What should you do in order to keep the data on EBS volumes safe? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Regularly update firmware on EBS devices.
options.C: Ensure that EBS data is encrypted at rest.
options.D: Store a backup daily in an external drive.
options.E: Prevent any unauthorized access to AWS data centers.

explanation: EBS snapshots create point-in-time backups of your volume stored in S3, and enabling encryption at rest protects the data from unauthorized access — both are standard practices for EBS data protection.

question: One of the most important AWS best-practices to follow is the cloud architecture principle of elasticity. How does this principle improve your architecture’s design?

options.A: By automatically scaling your on-premises resources based on changes in demand.
options.B: By automatically scaling your AWS resources using an Elastic Load Balancer.
options.C: By reducing interdependencies between application components wherever possible.
options.D: By automatically provisioning the required AWS resources based on changes in demand.

explanation: Elasticity means AWS automatically provisions or de-provisions resources in response to real-time changes in demand, ensuring you only use and pay for what you need.

question: A startup company is operating on limited funds and is extremely concerned about cost overruns. Which of the below options can be used to notify the company when their monthly AWS bill exceeds $2000? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Setup a CloudWatch billing alarm that triggers an SNS notification when the threshold is exceeded.
options.B: Configure the Amazon Simple Email Service to send billing alerts to their email address on a daily basis.
options.C: Configure the AWS Budgets Service to alert the company when the threshold is exceeded.
options.D: Configure AWS CloudTrail to automatically delete all AWS resources when the threshold is exceeded.
options.E: Configure the Amazon Connect Service to alert the company when the threshold is exceeded.

explanation: A CloudWatch billing alarm triggers an SNS notification when costs exceed a set threshold, and AWS Budgets lets you set custom cost thresholds with automatic alerts — both are native AWS tools for cost monitoring.

question: What does Amazon CloudFront use to distribute content to global users with low latency?
explanation: CloudFront delivers content from Edge Locations — a global network of points of presence — caching content close to end users to minimize latency.

question: What does the "Principle of Least Privilege" refer to?

options.A: You should grant your users only the permissions they need when they need them and nothing more.
options.B: All IAM users should have at least the necessary permissions to access the core AWS services.
options.C: All trusted IAM users should have access to any AWS service in the respective AWS account.
options.D: IAM users should not be granted any permissions; to keep your account safe.

explanation: The Principle of Least Privilege means granting users only the exact permissions they need to do their job, and nothing beyond that, to minimize the risk of accidental or malicious misuse.

question: Which of the following does NOT belong to the AWS Cloud Computing models?
explanation: The three AWS cloud computing models are IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS. Networking as a Service (NaaS) is not an AWS cloud model.

question: The identification process of an online financial services company requires that new users must complete an online interview with their security team. The completed recorded interviews are only required in the event of a legal issue or a regulatory compliance breach. What is the most cost-effective service to store the recorded videos?
explanation: S3 Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest-cost AWS storage class, designed for data that is rarely accessed and can tolerate retrieval times of hours — ideal for compliance archives that may never be needed.

question: Which service provides DNS in the AWS cloud?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is AWS's scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS) service, used to route end users to applications by translating domain names to IP addresses.

question: Hundreds of thousands of DDoS attacks are recorded every month worldwide. What service does AWS provide to help protect AWS Customers from these attacks? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS Shield provides managed DDoS protection at the network and transport layers, while AWS WAF allows you to create rules that filter malicious web traffic at the application layer — together they defend against DDoS attacks.

question: A company is deploying a new two-tier web application in AWS. Where should the most frequently accessed data be stored so that the application’s response time is optimal?
explanation: Amazon ElastiCache is an in-memory caching service that provides sub-millisecond response times for frequently accessed data, making it the best choice for optimizing application performance.

question: You want to run a questionnaire application for only one day (without interruption), which Amazon EC2 purchase option should you use?
explanation: On-Demand instances let you run workloads for any duration without long-term commitments or interruptions, making them ideal for short, one-time tasks where continuous availability is required.

question: You are working on a project that involves creating thumbnails of millions of images. Consistent uptime is not an issue, and continuous processing is not required. Which EC2 buying option would be the most cost-effective?
explanation: Spot Instances use spare AWS capacity at steep discounts and are perfect for fault-tolerant batch jobs like image processing, where interruptions are acceptable and uptime is not critical.

question: Which of the following can be described as a global content delivery network (CDN) service?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is AWS's global CDN service that caches and delivers content from Edge Locations worldwide, reducing latency for end users regardless of their location.

question: Which of the following services allows customers to manage their agreements with AWS?
explanation: AWS Artifact is a self-service portal where customers can access and manage AWS compliance reports and agreements, including NDA and BAA documents.

question: Which of the following are examples of AWS-Managed Services, where AWS is responsible for the operational and maintenance burdens of running the service? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EMR are fully managed services where AWS handles provisioning, patching, scaling, and maintenance. Unlike EC2 or VPC, customers do not manage the underlying infrastructure.

question: Your company has a data store application that requires access to a NoSQL database. Which AWS database offering would meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database, designed for applications that need fast, flexible, schema-less data storage.

question: As part of the Enterprise support plan, who is the primary point of contact for ongoing support needs?

options.A: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user.

explanation: The Technical Account Manager (TAM) is included in the Enterprise Support plan as the primary dedicated contact who provides proactive guidance and coordinates AWS support across your account.

question: How can you view the distribution of AWS spending in one of your AWS accounts?

options.B: By contacting the AWS Support team.
options.D: By contacting the AWS Finance team.

explanation: AWS Cost Explorer provides interactive charts and reports that visualize your AWS spending patterns over time, broken down by service, account, or tag.

question: Which of the following must an IAM user provide to interact with AWS services using the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)?
explanation: The AWS CLI uses access keys (an Access Key ID and Secret Access Key) to authenticate API requests programmatically, unlike the Management Console which uses username and password.

question: You have AWS Basic support, and you have discovered that some AWS resources are being used maliciously, and those resources could potentially compromise your data. What should you do?

options.A: Contact the AWS Customer Service team.

explanation: The AWS Abuse team handles reports of AWS infrastructure being used for malicious activity such as hacking, spam, or unauthorized use — this is available regardless of your support tier.

question: Select TWO examples of the AWS shared controls.
explanation: Shared controls are responsibilities that both AWS and the customer manage independently. Patch Management (AWS patches infrastructure, customers patch their OS/apps) and Configuration Management both fall into this category.

question: In order to implement best practices when dealing with a “Single Point of Failure,” you should attempt to build as much automation as possible in both detecting and reacting to failure. Which of the following AWS services would help? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically detects unhealthy instances and stops sending traffic to them, while Auto Scaling replaces failed instances automatically — together they eliminate single points of failure.

question: A company is planning to host an educational website on AWS. Their video courses will be streamed all around the world. Which of the following AWS services will help achieve high transfer speeds?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN that caches video content at Edge Locations around the world, delivering it to viewers from the nearest location and achieving high transfer speeds globally.

question: A developer is planning to build a two-tier web application that has a MySQL database layer. Which of the following AWS database services would provide automated backups for the application?

options.A: A MySQL database installed on an EC2 instance.

explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL-compatible managed relational database that automatically handles backups, replication, and failover, unlike running MySQL on EC2 where you manage everything yourself.

question: What is the AWS service that enables AWS architects to manage infrastructure as code?
explanation: AWS CloudFormation lets you define your entire AWS infrastructure as code using templates (JSON or YAML), enabling repeatable and automated provisioning of resources.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the responsibility of AWS?
explanation: Configuring infrastructure devices (networking hardware, physical servers, etc.) is entirely AWS's responsibility under the Shared Responsibility Model, as customers have no access to the underlying physical infrastructure.

question: What does the AWS Health Dashboard provide? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Detailed troubleshooting guidance to address AWS events impacting your resources.
options.B: Health checks for Auto Scaling instances.
options.D: A dashboard detailing vulnerabilities in your applications.
options.E: Personalized view of AWS service health.

explanation: AWS Health Dashboard provides a personalized view of how AWS service events affect your specific resources, along with detailed troubleshooting guidance to help you respond to and resolve those events.

question: You have deployed your application on multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Your customers complain that sometimes they can’t reach your application. Which AWS service allows you to monitor the performance of your EC2 instances to assist in troubleshooting these issues?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects and monitors metrics, logs, and events from EC2 instances, enabling you to set alarms and visualize performance data to diagnose availability and performance issues.

question: Your company is developing a critical web application in AWS, and the security of the application is a top priority. Which of the following AWS services will provide infrastructure security optimization recommendations?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and provides real-time recommendations across five categories including security, helping you follow AWS best practices to optimize your infrastructure.

question: Which of the following is not a benefit of Amazon S3? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Amazon S3 provides unlimited storage for any type of data.
options.B: Amazon S3 can run any type of application or backend system.
options.C: Amazon S3 stores any number of objects, but with object size limits.
options.D: Amazon S3 can be scaled manually to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere.
options.E: Amazon S3 provides 99.999999999% (11 9’s) of data durability.

explanation: S3 is object storage — it cannot run applications or backend systems (that's EC2/Lambda), and it scales automatically rather than manually. These two options misrepresent what S3 actually does.

question: In the AWS Shared responsibility Model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.B: Controlling physical access to compute resources.

explanation: Setting password complexity rules and configuring network access rules (like security groups and NACLs) are customer responsibilities — the customer controls their own identity policies and network configuration.

question: What does AWS provide to deploy popular technologies such as IBM MQ on AWS with the least amount of effort and time?
explanation: AWS Quick Start reference deployments are pre-built templates and architecture guides that let you deploy popular third-party technologies on AWS quickly, with minimal manual setup.

question: An organization has decided to purchase an Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance (RI) for three years in order to reduce costs. It is possible that the application workloads could change during the reservation period. What is the EC2 Reserved Instance (RI) type that will allow the company to exchange the purchased reserved instance for another reserved instance with higher computing power if they need to?
explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances allow you to exchange your reservation for one with different attributes (instance type, OS, tenancy) during the term, providing flexibility when workload requirements change.

question: Which of the following can an AWS customer use to launch a new Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster? (Select TWO)
explanation: CloudFormation lets you define and launch RDS clusters as infrastructure-as-code, while the AWS Management Console provides a visual interface to create them directly. AWS Concierge, S3, and EC2 Auto Scaling are not used to launch RDS clusters.

question: Which of the following Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models provides the highest average savings compared to On-Demand pricing?

options.A: One-year, No Upfront, Standard RI pricing.
options.B: One-year, All Upfront, Convertible RI pricing.
options.C: Three-year, All Upfront, Standard RI pricing.
options.D: Three-year, No Upfront, Convertible RI pricing.

explanation: Three-year All Upfront Standard RIs combine the longest commitment term with full prepayment and the Standard (non-convertible) type, which together yield the deepest discount compared to On-Demand pricing.

question: Which of the following are features of Amazon CloudWatch Logs? (Select TWO)

options.A: Summaries by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

explanation: CloudWatch Logs supports real-time monitoring of log data and configurable retention periods (adjustable retention), so you control how long logs are kept. It is not free and does not summarize through SNS.

question: Which of the following is an AWS-managed compute service?
explanation: AWS Lambda is fully managed by AWS—you upload code and AWS handles all underlying compute infrastructure. EC2 requires you to manage the OS and capacity; Aurora is a database, not a compute service.

question: A company wants to reduce the physical compute footprint that developers use to run code. Which service would meet that need by enabling serverless architectures?
explanation: AWS Lambda runs code without requiring you to provision or manage any servers, directly reducing the physical compute footprint. EC2 still requires server management; DynamoDB is a database; CodeCommit is source control.

question: Which of the following is the customer’s responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for patching the operating system and software on EC2 instances they launch. AWS patches the underlying hypervisor, physical hardware, and network infrastructure.

question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model who is responsible for configuration management?

options.A: It is solely the responsibility of the customer.
options.B: It is solely the responsibility of AWS.
options.C: It is shared between AWS and the customer.
options.D: It is not part of the AWS shared responsibility model.

explanation: Configuration management is a shared control: AWS manages the configuration of its infrastructure, while the customer is responsible for configuring the operating systems, databases, and applications they deploy.

question: Which security service automatically recognizes and classifies sensitive data or intellectual property on AWS?
explanation: Amazon Macie uses machine learning to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data (such as PII and intellectual property) stored in S3. GuardDuty detects threats; Inspector checks for vulnerabilities; Shield protects against DDoS.

question: Which of the following BEST describe the AWS pricing model? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS pricing is pay-as-you-go (you pay only for what you use) and variable cost (costs fluctuate with usage). There are no fixed terms required, no colocation fees, and no mandatory upfront plans.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the AWS customer? (Select TWO)

options.A: Ensuring that application data is encrypted at rest.
options.B: Ensuring that AWS NTP servers are set to the correct time.
options.C: Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services.
options.D: Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted.
options.E: Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly.

explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their application data at rest and for training their users on proper security practices. AWS is responsible for NTP server accuracy, physical data center access, and hardware disposal.

question: A customer is using multiple AWS accounts with separate billing. How can the customer take advantage of volume discounts with minimal impact to the AWS resources?

options.A: Create one global AWS account and move all AWS resources to that account.
options.B: Sign up for three years of Reserved Instance pricing up front.
options.C: Use the consolidated billing feature from AWS Organizations.
options.D: Sign up for the AWS Enterprise support plan to get volume discounts.

explanation: AWS Organizations consolidated billing aggregates usage across all member accounts, qualifying the organization for volume pricing tiers without requiring resource consolidation or upfront RI commitments.

question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model offers the MOST significant discount when compared to OnDemand Instances?

options.A: A Partial Upfront Reserved Instances for a 1-year term.
options.B: All Upfront Reserved instances for a 1 year form.
options.C: All Upfront Reserved Instances for a 3 year term.
options.D: No Upfront Reserved Instances for a 3 year term.

explanation: All Upfront Reserved Instances for a 3-year term provide the maximum possible EC2 discount because you combine the longest commitment (3 years) with full prepayment, unlike shorter terms or partial/no upfront options.

question: Which AWS services should be used for read/write of constantly changing data? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon RDS supports frequent read/write of relational data, while Amazon EFS provides a shared file system with concurrent read/write access. Glacier and Snowball are for archival/migration, and Redshift is optimized for analytical queries, not constant changes.

question: Which AWS service allows users to identify the changes made to a resource over time?
explanation: AWS Config continuously tracks and records configuration changes to AWS resources over time, allowing you to review historical configurations and identify what changed and when. Inspector checks for vulnerabilities; CloudTrail logs API calls.

question: According to best practices, how should an application be designed to run in the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS best practices recommend loosely coupled components so each part of an application can scale, fail, and be updated independently without cascading failures to other components.

question: Which benefits are included with the AWS Business Support plan? (Select TWO)

options.A: 24/7 assistance by way of live chat or a telephone call.
options.B: Support from a dedicated AWS Technical Account Manager.
options.C: An unlimited number of cases and contacts.
options.D: 15-minute response time for production system interruption cases.
options.E: Annual operational reviews with AWS Solutions Architects.

explanation: AWS Business Support includes 24/7 access to Cloud Support Engineers via phone, email, and chat, plus an unlimited number of support cases and contacts. A dedicated TAM and annual operational reviews are Enterprise-only features.

question: Which of the following is an AWS managed Domain Name System (DNS) web service?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is AWS's managed DNS web service that translates domain names to IP addresses and also provides routing policies, health checks, and domain registration. Neptune is a graph database; SageMaker is ML; Lightsail is simplified VMs.

question: A user must meet compliance and software licensing requirements that state a workload must be hosted on a physical server. When Amazon EC2 instance pricing option will meet these requirements?
explanation: EC2 Dedicated Hosts give you a physical server dedicated to your use, which is required for server-bound software licensing (BYOL) and certain compliance requirements. Dedicated Instances run on dedicated hardware but don't give visibility into the specific host.

question: Which of the Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models can change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of RIs of equal or greater value?
explanation: Convertible RIs allow you to exchange them for other Convertible RIs of equal or greater value, letting you change instance family, OS, tenancy, or payment option over the term. Standard RIs cannot be exchanged.

question: Which service is best for storing common database query results, which helps to alleviate database access load?
explanation: Amazon ElastiCache provides in-memory caching (Redis or Memcached) that stores frequently queried results, dramatically reducing repeated database reads and lowering database load. SQS is for queuing; EC2 instance store is ephemeral block storage.

question: When should a company consider using Amazon EC2 Spot Instances? (Select TWO)

options.C: For applications that cannot have interruptions.

explanation: Spot Instances are best for non-production applications that can tolerate interruptions and for fault-tolerant, flexible workloads that can checkpoint and resume. Stateful, high-uptime, or sensitive database workloads should not use Spot.

question: Which AWS tools assist with estimating costs? (Select three)

options.D: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator.

explanation: Cost allocation tags let you label resources and break down costs by project or team. The AWS Simple Monthly Calculator estimates service costs before provisioning. The TCO Calculator compares on-premises vs. AWS costs. Detailed billing reports show past costs but are not estimation tools.

question: A company wants to focus on business activities instead of managing compute and capacity. Which AWS service can be used to automatically add or remove Amazon EC2 instances based on demand?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling monitors demand and automatically adds or removes EC2 instances to maintain performance and minimize cost, so the team can focus on the application rather than capacity management.

question: Which is the minimum AWS Support plan that includes Infrastructure Event Management without additional costs?
explanation: Infrastructure Event Management (IEM) is included at no extra cost only with the Enterprise Support plan. Business plan customers can purchase IEM for an additional fee.

question: Access keys in AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) are used to:

options.A: Log in to the AWS Management Console.
options.B: Make programmatic calls to AWS from AWS APIs.
options.C: Log in to Amazon EC2 instances.

explanation: IAM access keys (access key ID + secret access key) are used to authenticate programmatic calls to AWS APIs via the CLI, SDKs, or direct HTTP requests. Console logins use username/password; EC2 instance access uses key pairs.

question: Which AWS service can be used to query stored datasets directly from Amazon S3 using standard SQL?
explanation: Amazon Athena lets you run standard SQL queries directly against data stored in S3 without loading it into a database. Glue is for ETL; Data Pipeline orchestrates data movement; CloudSearch is for search.

question: How does AWS shorten the time to provision IT resources?

options.A: It supplies an online IT ticketing platform for resource requests.
options.B: It supports automatic code validation services.
options.C: It provides the ability to programmatically provision existing resources.
options.D: It automates the resource request process from a company’s IT vendor list.

explanation: AWS allows you to provision resources programmatically through APIs, CloudFormation templates, and SDKs, drastically reducing the time to deploy infrastructure compared to traditional procurement and physical setup.

question: Which AWS services can be used to gather information about AWS account activity? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs all API calls and account activity, while Amazon CloudWatch collects metrics and log data from AWS services. Both provide visibility into account activity; CloudFront is a CDN; Cloud9 is an IDE; CloudHSM is hardware security module.

question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon S3? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 is an object store (stores objects with metadata and a key) and provides durable storage designed for 99.999999999% durability. It is not a file system, local file store, or network file system.

question: A user wants guidance on possible savings when migrating from on-premises to AWS. Which tool is suitable for this scenario?

options.C: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator.

explanation: The AWS TCO Calculator is designed specifically to compare total cost of ownership between on-premises infrastructure and AWS, helping users understand potential savings from migration.

question: Which of the following services is in the category of AWS serverless platform?
explanation: AWS Lambda is the serverless compute service where you run code without managing servers. EMR runs Hadoop/Spark clusters; ELB distributes traffic; Mobile Hub was a configuration tool—none are the core serverless compute platform.

question: The use of what AWS feature or service allows companies to track and categorize spending on a detailed level?
explanation: Cost allocation tags are key-value labels attached to AWS resources that enable you to organize and track spending at a granular level by project, team, or environment in Cost Explorer and billing reports.

question: Which of the following inspects AWS environments to find opportunities that can save money for users and also improve system performance?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor scans your AWS environment and provides recommendations across cost optimization, performance, security, fault tolerance, and service limits, helping save money and improve architecture.

question: Web servers running on Amazon EC2 access a legacy application running in a corporate data center. What term would describe this model?
explanation: When applications in the AWS cloud communicate with a legacy application in a corporate data center, this is a hybrid architecture—combining on-premises and cloud resources in a single solution.

question: What technology enables compute capacity to adjust as loads change?
explanation: Auto Scaling is the technology that monitors load and automatically adjusts the number of compute instances, ensuring capacity matches demand without manual intervention. Load balancing distributes traffic but doesn't change capacity.

question: Which AWS service is a managed NoSQL database?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL database service that supports key-value and document data structures. Redshift is a data warehouse; Aurora and RDS for MariaDB are relational (SQL) databases.

question: Which of the following is a correct relationship between regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations?
explanation: Regions are geographic areas that contain multiple Availability Zones. Each AZ consists of one or more data centers. Edge locations are separate points of presence for CloudFront, not contained within AZs.

question: What approach to transcoding a large number of individual video files adheres to AWS architecture principles?

options.B: Using a single large instance during off-peak hours.
options.D: Using a large GPU instance type.

explanation: AWS architecture principles favor horizontal scaling and parallelism. Transcoding many video files simultaneously using multiple parallel instances is faster and more cost-efficient than processing sequentially on one large instance.

question: Which AWS services can host a Microsoft SQL Server database? (Select TWO)
explanation: Microsoft SQL Server can run on EC2 instances (customer-managed) or be hosted via Amazon RDS for SQL Server (managed service). Aurora supports MySQL/PostgreSQL-compatible engines, not SQL Server; Redshift is a data warehouse; S3 is object storage.

question: Which AWS IAM feature allows developers to access AWS services through the AWS CLI?
explanation: IAM access keys (access key ID + secret access key) are the credentials used to authenticate CLI commands. API keys is not an AWS term; username/password is for console access; SSH keys are for EC2 instance access.

question: The user is fully responsible for which action when running workloads on AWS?

options.D: Implementing controls to route application traffic.

explanation: When running workloads on AWS, customers are fully responsible for designing and implementing application-level controls such as routing application traffic. AWS manages infrastructure patching, physical controls, and the underlying network.

question: Which AWS support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager?
explanation: A dedicated Technical Account Manager (TAM) who provides proactive guidance and acts as a primary contact is exclusively available with the AWS Enterprise Support plan.

question: What time-savings advantage is offered with the use of Amazon Rekognition?

options.A: Amazon Rekognition provides automatic watermarking of images.
options.B: Amazon Rekognition provides automatic detection of objects appearing in pictures.
options.C: Amazon Recognition provides the ability to resize millions of images automatically.
options.D: Amazon Rekognition uses Amazon Mechanical Turk to allow humans to bid on object detection jobs.

explanation: Amazon Rekognition automatically analyzes images and videos to detect objects, scenes, faces, text, and activities, saving the time that would otherwise be spent on manual image review or building custom ML pipelines.

question: Which AWS service can be used to automatically scale an application up and down without making capacity planning decisions?
explanation: Amazon Auto Scaling (EC2 Auto Scaling) automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances based on defined policies, eliminating the need for manual capacity planning decisions. Lambda is serverless event-driven compute, not a scaling service for existing apps.

question: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) offers which of the following benefits over traditional database management?

options.A: AWS manages the data stored in Amazon RDS tables.
options.B: AWS manages the maintenance of the operating system.
options.C: AWS automatically scales up instance types on demand.

explanation: With Amazon RDS, AWS manages the underlying operating system patching, backups, and maintenance windows, freeing customers from OS-level administration. Customers still manage the data, schema, and database-level configuration.

question: A company’s web application currently has light dependencies on underlying components so when one component fails the entire web application fails. Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?

options.A: Implementing elasticity enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
options.B: Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
options.C: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
options.D: Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.

explanation: Decoupling components means isolating them so each can function independently; if one fails, others continue operating. This directly addresses tightly coupled architecture where a single failure brings down the whole application.

question: A customer would like to design and build a new workload on AWS Cloud but does not have the AWS-related software technical expertise in-house. Which of the following AWS programs can a customer take advantage of to achieve that outcome?
explanation: AWS Partner Network (APN) Consulting Partners are professional services firms that help customers design, build, migrate, and manage AWS workloads. Technology Partners provide software/tools; the Marketplace is for purchasing software.

question: Which service stores objects, provides real-time access to those objects, and offers versioning and lifecycle capabilities?
explanation: Amazon S3 stores objects with real-time access, supports versioning to track and restore previous versions, and offers lifecycle policies to manage object transitions—making it the service that matches all three described capabilities.

question: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones supports which cloud architecture design principle?
explanation: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones ensures the application can continue operating if one AZ fails, embodying the 'design for failure' principle—the architecture anticipates and accommodates component failures.

question: Which service should a customer use to consolidate and centrally manage multiple AWS accounts?
explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to create a hierarchy of AWS accounts, consolidate billing, and apply governance policies (SCPs) centrally. IAM manages users/permissions within a single account; Config tracks configurations; Schema Conversion Tool is for database migration.

question: How can a company reduce its Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) using AWS?

options.B: By having no responsibility for third-party license costs.

explanation: AWS shifts infrastructure spending from large upfront capital expenditures (buying servers) to smaller, ongoing operational expenses (paying for usage), directly reducing TCO by eliminating the need to over-provision for peak demand.

question: Which options does AWS make available for customers who want to learn about security in the cloud in an instructor-led setting? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Online Tech Talks are live and on-demand webinars that include Q&A, and AWS Classroom Training offers instructor-led courses—both are instructor-led or live settings. Blogs, forums, and Trusted Advisor are self-service resources, not instructor-led.

question: Which of the following will enhance the security of access to the AWS Management Console’? (Select TWO)
explanation: MFA adds a second authentication factor beyond a password, and strong password policies enforce complexity and rotation—both directly protect console logins. Secrets Manager, Certificate Manager, and security groups do not control console authentication.

question: Which of the following features can be configured through the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) Dashboard? (Select TWO)
explanation: Security Groups (stateful firewall rules for instances) and Subnets (network segmentation) are core VPC components configured via the VPC Dashboard. CloudFront, Route 53, and ELB are separate services with their own dashboards.

question: For which auditing process does AWS have sole responsibility?
explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, AWS has sole responsibility for physical security of its data centers, including controls such as perimeter security, surveillance, and hardware disposal. IAM policies, S3 bucket policies, and CloudTrail logs are customer-managed.

question: Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing? (Select TWO)

options.A: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts.
options.B: Service limits increasing by default in all accounts.
options.C: A fixed discount on the monthly bill.
options.D: Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined.
options.E: The automatic extension of the master account’s AWS support plan to all accounts.

explanation: Consolidated billing produces a single combined invoice for all accounts in an AWS Organization, and it pools usage across all accounts to qualify for volume pricing tiers. Support plans are not shared, service limits are not automatically increased, and discounts are not fixed.

question: Which of the following common IT tasks can AWS cover to free up company IT resources? (Select TWO)
explanation: For managed database services like RDS, AWS handles OS patching and automated backups on behalf of the customer, freeing IT teams from these routine tasks. Application testing, schema creation, and penetration testing remain customer responsibilities.

question: A company wants to expand from one AWS Region into a second AWS Region. What does the company need to do to start supporting the new Region?

options.A: Contact an AWS Account Manager to sign a new contract.
options.B: Move an Availability Zone to the new Region.
options.C: Begin deploying resources in the second Region.
options.D: Download the AWS Management Console for the new Region.

explanation: AWS Regions are available globally and customers can begin provisioning resources in any Region at any time through the console, CLI, or API—no contract or separate download is needed.

question: Why is it beneficial to use Elastic Load Balancers with applications?

options.A: They allow for the conversion from Application Load.
options.C: They are capable of handling constant changes in network traffic patterns.
options.D: They automatically adjust capacity. They are provided at no charge to users.

explanation: Elastic Load Balancers automatically distribute incoming traffic across multiple targets and adapt to changing traffic patterns without manual intervention, ensuring no single target is overwhelmed. ELB is not free, and it does not convert between load balancer types.

question: Which is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan that allows for one-hour target response time for support cases?
explanation: AWS Business Support guarantees a one-hour response time for production system-down cases and provides 24/7 phone, email, and chat access. Developer Support offers business-hours email only; Basic has no case support; Enterprise offers faster response but at higher cost.

question: What is the lowest-cost, durable storage option for retaining database backups for immediate retrieval?
explanation: Amazon S3 Standard provides durable, highly available object storage with immediate retrieval, and is more cost-effective than EBS for backup storage. Glacier requires retrieval time (minutes to hours); EC2 instance store is ephemeral and disappears when the instance stops.

question: What AWS team assists customers with accelerating cloud adoption through paid engagements in any of several specialty practice areas?
explanation: AWS Professional Services is a global team of experts that helps customers achieve their desired business outcomes on AWS through paid engagements. Solutions Architects advise on architecture; Account Managers handle relationships; Enterprise Support is a support tier, not a consulting engagement.

question: A company needs 24/7 phone email and chat access with a response time of less than 1 hour if a production system has a service interruption Which AWS Support plan meets these requirements at the LOWEST cost?
explanation: AWS Business Support is the lowest-cost plan that provides 24/7 phone, email, and chat access with a one-hour response SLA for production system interruptions. Developer Support only offers business-hours email; Basic has no technical case support.

question: If a customer needs to audit the change management of AWS resources, which of the following AWS services should the customer use?
explanation: AWS Config continuously records resource configurations and changes over time, providing a detailed audit trail of what changed, when, and who made the change. CloudTrail records API calls; CloudWatch monitors metrics; Inspector checks for vulnerabilities.

question: How does AWS Trusted Advisor provide guidance to users of the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)

options.A: It identifies software vulnerabilities in applications running on AWS.
options.B: It provides a list of cost optimization recommendations based on current AWS usage.
options.C: It detects potential security vulnerabilities caused by permissions settings on account resources.
options.D: It automatically corrects potential security issues caused by permissions settings on account resources.
options.E: It provides proactive alerting whenever an Amazon EC2 instance has been compromised.

explanation: Trusted Advisor analyzes your AWS environment and provides cost optimization recommendations based on current usage patterns, and it flags potential security issues caused by overly permissive IAM or resource settings. It does not automatically remediate issues or alert on compromised instances.

question: Which AWS managed service is used to host databases?
explanation: Amazon RDS is AWS's fully managed relational database service that supports multiple database engines (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, etc.). AWS Batch is for batch computing; Artifact is for compliance documents; Data Pipeline orchestrates data movement.

question: Which of the following Identity and Access Management (IAM) entities is associated with an access key ID and secret access key when using AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)?
explanation: IAM users are the entities that have access keys (access key ID + secret access key) associated with them for programmatic CLI access. IAM groups, roles, and policies themselves do not have access keys; roles use temporary credentials.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the customer responsible for?

options.A: Ensuring that disk drives are wiped after use.
options.B: Ensuring that firmware is updated on hardware devices.
options.C: Ensuring that data is encrypted at rest.
options.D: Ensuring that network cables are category six or higher.

explanation: Data encryption at rest is a customer responsibility under the shared responsibility model—AWS provides the encryption tools and services, but the customer decides whether and how to encrypt their data. AWS is responsible for hardware firmware, disk wiping, and network cabling.

question: Which AWS service provides a simple and scalable shared file storage solution for use with Linux-based AWS and on-premises servers?
explanation: Amazon EFS is a managed NFS file system that can be mounted by multiple Linux EC2 instances simultaneously and also accessed from on-premises servers, providing simple, scalable shared file storage. S3 and Glacier are object stores; EBS volumes attach to a single instance.

question: What credential components are required to gain programmatic access to an AWS account? (Select TWO)
explanation: Programmatic AWS access requires an access key ID and a secret access key together to authenticate API requests via the CLI or SDKs. A primary key, user ID, or secondary key are not valid AWS credential components.

question: Which of the following is a shared control between the customer and AWS?

options.A: Providing a key for Amazon S3 client-side encryption.
options.B: Configuration of an Amazon EC2 instance.
options.C: Environmental controls of physical AWS data centers.

explanation: Awareness and training is a shared control—both AWS and the customer must independently ensure their respective staff understands security responsibilities. Client-side encryption keys, EC2 configuration, and physical data center controls are either solely customer or solely AWS responsibilities.

question: Which type of AWS storage is ephemeral and is deleted when an instance is stopped Of terminated?
explanation: EC2 instance store is physically attached to the host and provides ephemeral block storage that is lost when the instance stops or terminates. EBS volumes persist independently of the instance lifecycle; EFS and S3 are network-accessible and durable.

question: Which of the following is an advantage of consolidated billing on AWS?
explanation: Consolidated billing combines usage from all member accounts in an AWS Organization, qualifying the organization for volume pricing tiers (e.g., S3 storage discounts) that individual accounts might not reach on their own. It does not share permissions, create multiple bills, or eliminate the need for tags.

question: Which services are parts of the AWS serverless platform?

options.A: Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon Athena.
options.B: Amazon Kinesis, Amazon SQS, Amazon EMR.
options.C: AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon SNS.
options.D: Amazon Athena, Amazon Cognito, Amazon EC2.

explanation: AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon SNS are all serverless services—they require no server provisioning and scale automatically. Amazon EC2 and EMR require server management; Kinesis and SQS are managed but not purely serverless in the same category.

question: Which of the following Amazon EC2 pricing models allow customers to use existing server-bound software licenses?
explanation: EC2 Dedicated Hosts provide a physical server dedicated to your use, which is required to use existing per-socket, per-core, or per-VM software licenses (BYOL). Spot, Reserved, and On-Demand all run on shared or unspecified hardware and do not support license binding to specific physical hosts.

question: Which of the following security measures protect access to an AWS account? (Select TWO)

options.B: Grant least privilege access to IAM users.
options.C: Create one IAM user and share with many developers and users.
options.E: Activate multi-factor authentication (MFA) for privileged users.

explanation: Granting least privilege access ensures users only have the permissions they need, reducing the blast radius of a compromise, and enabling MFA for privileged users adds a critical second authentication factor. CloudTrail logs activity but doesn't prevent unauthorized access; sharing IAM users is a security anti-pattern.

question: Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?
explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to define AWS infrastructure in JSON or YAML templates (infrastructure as code), enabling repeatable, automated provisioning. CodePipeline automates CI/CD; CodeDeploy deploys application code; Direct Connect provides dedicated network connectivity.

question: What is an advantage of deploying an application across multiple Availability Zones?

options.A: There is a lower risk of service failure if a natural disaster causes a service disruption in a given AWS Region.
options.B: The application will have higher availability because it can withstand a service disruption in one Availability Zone.
options.C: There will be better coverage as Availability Zones are geographical^ distant and can serve a wider area.
options.D: There will be decreased application latency that will improve the user experience.

explanation: When one Availability Zone experiences an outage, traffic fails over to instances in the other AZ(s), keeping the application running. Multiple AZs within a Region do not protect against a full-Region disaster, but they do provide protection against single-AZ failures.

question: A customer needs to run a MySQL database that easily scales. Which AWS service should they use?
explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud that automatically scales storage and can handle high throughput. Redshift is a data warehouse; DynamoDB is NoSQL; ElastiCache is an in-memory cache.

question: Which of the following is an AWS Cloud architecture design principle?
explanation: Loose coupling is a core AWS cloud architecture principle where components interact through well-defined interfaces, allowing each to scale, update, or fail independently without cascading effects. Tight coupling, monolithic design, and vertical scaling are anti-patterns for cloud-native architectures.

question: AWS Enterprise Support users have access to which service or feature that is not available to users with other AWS Support plans?
explanation: The AWS Support Concierge team—dedicated billing and account experts who provide personalized guidance—is available exclusively to Enterprise Support customers. Trusted Advisor and support cases are available on lower-tier plans; Amazon Connect is a contact center service.

question: A company will be moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud. What would be one financial difference after the move?

options.A: Moving from variable operational expense ( opex ) to upfront capital expense (capex).
options.B: Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable capital expense (capex).
options.C: Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable operational expense ( opex ).
options.D: Elimination of upfront capital expense (capex) and elimination of variable operational expense ( opex ).

explanation: On-premises infrastructure requires large upfront capital expenditures (buying hardware) and ongoing fixed costs. Moving to AWS converts this to variable operational expense—you pay only for what you use, with no upfront hardware purchases.

question: When performing a cost analysis that supports physical isolation of a customer workload, which compute hosting model should be accounted for in the Total Cost of Ownership (TCO)?
explanation: EC2 Dedicated Hosts provide physical isolation of the workload on a server dedicated entirely to one customer, which is required for certain compliance mandates or licensing models. This hosting model has a higher cost that must be factored into TCO calculations.

question: Which AWS service should be used for long-term, low-cost storage of data backups?
explanation: Amazon S3 Glacier is designed for long-term archival and data backup at very low storage costs, making it the ideal service for retaining backups cheaply. RDS is for active databases; Snowball is for data migration; EBS is block storage attached to EC2.

question: Which is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan that provides technical support through phone calls?
explanation: AWS Business Support is the minimum plan that includes 24/7 phone support with a dedicated team of Cloud Support Engineers. Developer Support only provides email during business hours; Basic has no technical phone or case support.

question: Which Amazon EC2 instance pricing model can provide discounts of up to 90%?
explanation: Spot Instances use spare AWS capacity and can offer discounts of up to 90% compared to On-Demand prices. Reserved Instances offer up to ~72% discount; On-Demand is the baseline price; Dedicated Hosts typically cost more than standard options.

question: Which of the following AWS services can be used to serve large amounts of online video content with the lowest possible latency? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 and Amazon CloudFront together provide scalable, globally distributed video delivery: S3 stores the content and CloudFront's edge locations cache and deliver it to users worldwide with low latency. EFS is a file system; Glacier is for archival; API Gateway is for APIs.

question: What can AWS edge locations be used for? (Select TWO)

options.D: Reducing traffic on the server by caching responses.
options.E: Sending notification messages to end users.

explanation: CloudFront edge locations deliver cached content (like web pages and videos) closer to end users to reduce latency, and they absorb repeated requests from the origin server, reducing the traffic burden. Edge locations cannot host applications or run database services.

question: A company is planning to migrate from on-premises to the AWS Cloud. When AWS tool or service provides detailed reports on estimated cost savings after migration?

options.A: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator.

explanation: The AWS TCO Calculator is specifically designed to model and compare the total cost of on-premises vs. AWS deployments, producing detailed reports on estimated savings from migration. Cost Explorer and Budgets track actual spending; Migration Hub tracks migration progress.

question: Which AWS service provides a customized view of the health of specific AWS services that power a customer’s workloads running on AWS?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides a personalized view of the health of the specific AWS services being used by your account, including alerts about events that may affect your resources. The Service Health Dashboard shows global service status; CloudWatch monitors metrics; X-Ray traces application performance.

question: One of the advantages to moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud is:

options.A: It allows the business to eliminate IT bills.
options.B: It allows the business to put a server in each customer’s data center.
options.C: It allows the business to focus on business activities.
options.D: It allows the business to leave servers unpatched.

explanation: By offloading infrastructure management to AWS, companies can redirect their IT staff and resources toward developing and improving their core products and services rather than maintaining data centers.

question: How can an AWS user with an AWS Basic Support plan obtain technical assistance from AWS?
explanation: AWS Basic Support includes access to AWS documentation, whitepapers, and community Discussion Forums where other users and AWS staff may respond to questions. TAMs are Enterprise-only; Senior Support Engineers are Business/Enterprise-only; Trusted Advisor is limited to basic checks on the free plan.

question: How can a user protect against AWS service disruptions if a natural disaster affects an entire geographic area?

options.A: Deploy applications across multiple Availability Zones within an AWS Region.
options.B: Use a hybrid cloud computing deployment model within the geographic area.
options.C: Deploy applications across multiple AWS Regions.
options.D: Store application artifacts using AWS Artifact and replicate them across multiple AWS Regions.

explanation: A natural disaster affecting an entire geographic area could take down a whole AWS Region. Deploying across multiple Regions in different geographies protects against this scenario, unlike multi-AZ deployments which only protect against single-AZ failures within one Region.

question: Which activity is a customer responsibility in the AWS Cloud according to the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.A: Ensuring network connectivity from AWS to the internet.
options.B: Patching and fixing flaws within the AWS Cloud infrastructure.
options.C: Ensuring the physical security of cloud data centers.
options.D: Ensuring Amazon EBS volumes are backed up.

explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, backing up EBS volumes (e.g., taking snapshots) is the customer's responsibility—AWS does not automatically back up EBS volumes. AWS is responsible for network connectivity, infrastructure patching, and physical data center security.

question: In which scenario should Amazon EC2 Spot Instances be used?

options.A: A company wants to move its main website to AWS from an on-premises web server.
options.B: A company has a number of application services whose Service Level Agreement (SLA) requires 99.999% uptime.
options.C: A company’s heavily used legacy database is currently running on-premises.
options.D: A company has a number of infrequent, interruptible jobs that are currently using On-Demand Instances.

explanation: Spot Instances are ideal for flexible, interruptible workloads that can tolerate being interrupted when capacity is reclaimed. High-availability services (99.999% SLA), production websites, and legacy databases all require consistent availability that Spot Instances cannot guarantee.

question: A customer is deploying a new application and needs to choose an AWS Region. Which of the following factors could influence the customer’s decision? (Select TWO)

options.B: The application’s presentation in the local language.
options.E: Proximity to the customer’s office for on-site visits.

explanation: Proximity to users (reduced network latency) and data sovereignty/compliance requirements (laws that mandate data stay within certain geographic boundaries) are the two primary technical and regulatory factors in Region selection. Language, cooling, and office proximity are not valid technical criteria.

question: Which AWS service provides alerts when an AWS event may impact a company’s AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard sends personalized alerts and remediation guidance when AWS events might affect specific resources in your account. The Service Health Dashboard shows broad, general AWS service status without personalization to your specific resources.

question: Which disaster recovery scenario offers the lowest probability of down time?
explanation: Multi-site active-active runs fully redundant, live copies of your application across multiple sites simultaneously, so if one site fails, the other immediately serves all traffic with essentially zero downtime. Backup/restore, pilot light, and warm standby all require some recovery time.

question: Which service’s PRIMARY purpose is software version control?
explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a fully managed Git-based source control service designed specifically for software version control. CodeStar is a project management dashboard; the CLI is a command-line interface; Cognito is for user authentication.

question: How can a customer increase security to AWS account logons? (Select TWO)

options.C: Use Amazon Cognito to manage access

explanation: Enabling MFA requires a second factor (e.g., a virtual authenticator app) beyond the password, and a strong password policy enforces complexity, length, and rotation—both directly strengthen account logon security. Cognito manages app user pools; Organizations manages multi-account governance; Certificate Manager handles SSL/TLS certificates.

question: Which of the following components of the AWS Global Infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers interconnected through low latency links?
explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is composed of one or more discrete data centers, each with independent power and networking, connected to other AZs in the Region via low-latency links. Edge locations and Regions are separate infrastructure layers; private networking is not a global infrastructure component.

question: One benefit of On-Demand Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) pricing is:

options.A: The ability to bid for a lower hourly cost.
options.B: Paying a daily rate regardless of time used.
options.D: Pre-paying for instances and paying a lower hourly rate.

explanation: On-Demand pricing means you pay only for the compute time you actually use, with no upfront costs or long-term commitments. Bidding is a Spot Instance feature; daily rate billing and pre-payment are characteristics of other pricing models.

question: What can assist in evaluating an application for migration to the cloud? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Professional Services provides expert consulting engagements to help evaluate and plan migrations, and AWS Partner Network (APN) partners offer specialized migration expertise. Trusted Advisor checks best practices but doesn't evaluate migration fit; Systems Manager and Secrets Manager are operational tools, not migration advisory services.

question: A characteristic of edge locations is that they:

options.A: Host Amazon EC2 instances closer to users.
options.B: Help lower latency and improve performance for users.
options.C: Cache frequently changing data without reaching the origin server.

explanation: CloudFront edge locations cache content geographically close to end users, reducing round-trip distance and lowering latency to improve performance. They do not host EC2 instances, and they cache static or infrequently changing content—not frequently changing data.

question: Which of the following are valid ways for a customer to interact with AWS services? (Select TWO)
explanation: The AWS CLI allows programmatic control of services from the command line, and SDKs enable interaction from within application code in various programming languages. On-premises, SaaS, and hybrid describe deployment models, not interaction methods with AWS APIs.

question: What is a value proposition of the AWS Cloud?

options.A: AWS is responsible for security in the AWS Cloud.
options.D: AWS manages user applications in the AWS Cloud.

explanation: One of AWS's core value propositions is the absence of long-term contracts—customers can use services on a pay-as-you-go basis and stop at any time. AWS does not manage user applications; provisioning in minutes (not days) is the reality; and security is a shared responsibility.

question: A company is migrating an application that is running non-interruptible workloads for a three-year time frame. Which pricing construct would provide the MOST cost-effective solution?
explanation: For steady-state, non-interruptible workloads running over a three-year period, Reserved Instances offer the largest discount (up to ~72%) compared to On-Demand. Spot Instances can be interrupted; On-Demand has no discount; Dedicated Instances are for isolation, not cost savings.

question: Which AWS service is used to track record, and audit configuration changes made to AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Config continuously records configuration changes to AWS resources and maintains a history of those changes, enabling audit and compliance reviews. Shield is for DDoS protection; IAM manages identities; Inspector assesses application vulnerabilities.

question: Which feature of the AWS Cloud will support an international company’s requirement for low latency to all of its customers?
explanation: AWS's global reach—its worldwide network of Regions and edge locations—enables companies to deploy applications and serve content close to users anywhere in the world, reducing latency. Fault tolerance and high availability address uptime, not geographic proximity; pay-as-you-go is a pricing model.

question: How can one AWS account use Reserved Instances from another AWS account?

options.A: By using Amazon EC2 Dedicated Instances.
options.B: By using AWS Organizations consolidated billing.
options.C: By using the AWS Cost Explorer tool.

explanation: AWS Organizations consolidated billing pools Reserved Instance usage across all member accounts, so unused RIs in one account can automatically apply to matching usage in another, reducing costs across the organization. Cost Explorer, Budgets, and Dedicated Instances don't facilitate RI sharing between accounts.

question: What are the benefits of developing and running a new application in the AWS Cloud compared to on-premises? (Select TWO)

options.A: AWS automatically distributes the data globally for higher durability.
options.B: AWS will take care of operating the application.
options.C: AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability.
options.D: AWS can easily accommodate application demand changes.
options.E: AWS takes care of application security patching.

explanation: AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability using multi-AZ deployments, load balancers, and managed services, and the cloud's elasticity allows applications to scale up or down to match demand changes quickly. AWS does not automatically distribute all data globally or take over application operations and security patching.

question: Which of the following services falls under the responsibility of the customer to maintain operating system configuration, security patching, and networking?
explanation: With Amazon EC2, the customer is responsible for the guest OS, including configuration, security patching, and networking setup. With fully managed services like RDS, ElastiCache, and Fargate, AWS handles the OS-level maintenance on the customer's behalf.

question: AWS supports which of the following methods to add security to Identity and Access Management (IAM) users? (Select TWO)
explanation: MFA adds a second authentication factor beyond a password, and enforcing password strength and expiration policies reduce the risk of credential compromise. Rekognition is image/video analysis; Shield is DDoS protection; security groups control network traffic, not IAM authentication.

question: Which service provides a hybrid storage service that enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use cloud storage?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid storage service that integrates on-premises environments with AWS cloud storage, presenting cloud storage as local file shares, volumes, or tape to on-premises applications. Glacier is archival storage; Snowball is for physical data migration; EBS is block storage for EC2.

question: Where should a company go to search software listings from independent software vendors to find, test, buy and deploy software that runs on AWS?
explanation: AWS Marketplace is the curated digital catalog where independent software vendors list their products, allowing customers to find, test, buy, and deploy software that runs on AWS. Artifact is for compliance documents; Lumberyard is a game engine; CloudSearch is a managed search service.

question: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
explanation: AWS Regions are the physical, geographically distributed components of the AWS Global Infrastructure, each containing multiple Availability Zones. Alexa is a voice assistant service; Lightsail is a compute service; Organizations is an account management tool—none are infrastructure components.

question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model adjusts based on supply and demand of EC2 instances?
explanation: Spot Instance pricing fluctuates in real time based on the available supply of spare EC2 capacity and customer demand, which can result in prices up to 90% lower than On-Demand. On-Demand and Reserved Instance prices are set by AWS and do not fluctuate with supply and demand.

question: A company wants to migrate its applications to a VPC on AWS These applications will need to access on-premises resources. What combination of actions will enable the company to accomplish this goals? (Select TWO)

options.A: Use the AWS Service Catalog to identify a list of on-premises resources that can be migrated
options.B: Build a VPN connection between an on-premises device and a virtual private gateway in the new VPC
options.C: Use Amazon Athena to query data from the on-premises database servers
options.D: Connect the company’s on-premises data center to AWS using AWS Direct Connect
options.E: Leverage Amazon CloudFront to restrict access to static web content provided through the company’s on-premises web servers

explanation: A site-to-site VPN through a virtual private gateway provides an encrypted tunnel over the internet between on-premises and the VPC, and AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network link—both extend the on-premises network into AWS. Athena queries S3 data; Service Catalog manages product portfolios; CloudFront distributes content.

question: A Cloud Practitioner must determine if any security groups in an AWS account have been provisioned to allow unrestricted access for specific ports. What is the SIMPLEST way to do this?

options.A: Review the inbound rules for each security group in the Amazon EC2 management console to check for port 0.0.0.0/0.
options.B: Run AWS Trusted Advisor and review the findings.
options.C: Open the AWS IAM console and check the inbound rule filters for open access.
options.D: In AWS Config, create a custom rule that invokes an AWS Lambda function to review firewall rules for inbound access.

explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor automatically scans your account and flags security groups with unrestricted access (0.0.0.0/0) to specific ports as part of its Security checks, making it the simplest approach. Manually reviewing each security group in the console is tedious; IAM console manages identities, not security groups; creating a custom Config rule requires significant setup effort.

question: Which of the following security-related services does AWS offer? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor includes security checks (such as identifying open security groups) and AWS provides data encryption capabilities (KMS, S3 encryption, etc.) as security-related services. AWS does not provide physical MFA tokens, perform automated penetration testing, or detect copyrighted content in S3.
