explanation: Cost allocation tags are key-value metadata that you apply to AWS resources, enabling you to segment and categorize costs by project, department, or environment in AWS Cost Explorer and Cost & Usage Reports.

question: What is the main benefit of attaching security groups to an Amazon RDS instance?

options.A: Manages user access and encryption keys.
options.B: Controls what IP address ranges can connect to your database instance.
options.C: Deploys SSL/TLS certificates for use with your database instance.
options.D: Distributes incoming traffic across multiple targets.

explanation: Security groups attached to an RDS instance act as a virtual firewall that controls which IP address ranges and EC2 instances are allowed to connect to the database, restricting network access.

question: A company wants to use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) to run its containerized applications. For compliance reasons, the company wants to retain complete visibility and control over the underlying server cluster. Which Amazon ECS launch type will satisfy these requirements?
explanation: The EC2 launch type for Amazon ECS runs containers on EC2 instances that you manage, giving you full visibility and control over the underlying server cluster, unlike Fargate which abstracts the infrastructure.

question: You have multiple standalone AWS accounts and you want to decrease your AWS monthly charges. What should you do?

options.A: Try to remove unnecessary AWS accounts.
options.B: Add the accounts to an AWS Organization and use Consolidated Billing.
options.C: Track the AWS charges that are incurred by the member accounts.
options.D: Enable AWS tiered-pricing before provisioning resources.

explanation: Adding standalone accounts to an AWS Organization with Consolidated Billing aggregates usage across all accounts, enabling volume discounts and simplifying payment through a single bill.

question: You have been tasked with auditing the security of your VPC. As part of this process, you need to start by analyzing what inbound and outbound traffic is allowed on your EC2 instances. What two parts of the VPC do you need to check to accomplish this task?
explanation: Security Groups control inbound and outbound traffic at the instance level, and Network ACLs control traffic at the subnet level. Together they define the complete traffic rules for your EC2 instances.

question: What does the AWS "Business" support plan provide? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks.
options.C: Less than 15 minutes response-time support if your business critical system goes down.

explanation: The Business Support plan provides access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks and the AWS Support API for programmatic case management. Concierge and TAM are Enterprise-only features.

question: You have just finished writing your application code. Which service can be used to automate the deployment and scaling of your application?
explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles deployment, capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling, and application health monitoring, letting you focus on writing code.

question: Which statement is true in relation to security in AWS?

options.A: AWS manages everything related to EC2 operating systems.
options.B: AWS customers are responsible for patching any database software running on Amazon EC2.
options.C: Server side encryption is the responsibility of AWS.
options.D: AWS is responsible for the security of your application.

explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, customers are responsible for patching and maintaining any software they install on EC2 instances, including database software, operating systems, and applications.

question: Amazon EC2 instances are conceptually very similar to traditional servers. However, using Amazon EC2 server instances in the same manner as traditional hardware server instances is only a starting point. What are the main benefits of using the AWS EC2 instances instead of traditional servers? (Choose TWO)

options.B: Provides your business with a seamless remote accessibility.
options.C: Prevents unauthorized users from getting into your network.
options.E: Can be scaled manually in a shorter period of time.

explanation: EC2 instances improve fault tolerance through features like Auto Scaling, Multi-AZ deployment, and ELB integration, and they can be scaled up or down manually in minutes rather than the weeks required for physical hardware.

question: Which statement is true regarding AWS pricing? (Choose TWO)

options.A: With the AWS pay-as-you-go pricing model, you don't have to pay any upfront fee.
options.B: You have no responsibility for third-party software license costs.
options.C: You only pay for the individual services that you need with no long-term contracts.
options.D: For some services, you have to pay a startup fee in order to get the service running.
options.E: There are no reservations on AWS, you only pay for what you use.

explanation: AWS pay-as-you-go pricing requires no upfront fees or long-term contracts. You pay only for the individual services you consume, scaling costs up or down with actual usage.

question: Which AWS service provides the EASIEST way to set up and manage a secure, well-architected, multi-account AWS environment?
explanation: AWS Control Tower automates the setup of a secure, well-architected multi-account environment based on AWS best practices, providing pre-configured guardrails and a landing zone dashboard.

question: A company is running a large web application that needs to always be available. The application tends to slow down when CPU usage is greater than 60%. How can they track when CPU usage goes above 60% for any of the EC2 Instances in their account?

options.A: Use CloudFront to monitor the CPU usage.
options.B: Set the AWS Config CPU threshold to 60% to receive a notification when EC2 usage exceeds that value.
options.C: Use CloudWatch Alarms to monitor the CPU and alert when the CPU usage is >= 60%.
options.D: Use SNS to monitor the utilization of the server.

explanation: Amazon CloudWatch Alarms let you define thresholds on metrics like CPU utilization and trigger notifications or automated actions when the threshold is breached, such as alerting when CPU exceeds 60%.

question: What is the recommended storage option when hosting an often-changing database on an Amazon EC2 instance?

options.C: You can't run a database inside an Amazon EC2 instance.

explanation: Amazon EBS provides persistent block storage volumes that attach to EC2 instances, delivering the consistent low-latency I/O performance needed for databases with frequently changing data.

question: You are working as a site reliability engineer (SRE) in an AWS environment, which of the following services helps monitor your applications?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch monitors applications and infrastructure by collecting metrics, logs, and events, providing dashboards and alarms that help SREs identify and respond to operational issues.

question: What factors determine how you are charged when using AWS Lambda? (Choose TWO)

options.B: Number of requests to your functions.

explanation: AWS Lambda pricing is based on the number of requests to your functions and the compute time consumed (measured in GB-seconds), so you only pay when your code is actually running.

question: What are the main differences between an IAM user and an IAM role in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: An IAM user is uniquely associated with only one person, however a role is intended to be assumable by anyone who needs it.
options.B: An IAM user has permanent credentials associated with it, however a role has temporary credentials associated with it.
options.C: IAM users are more cost effective than IAM roles.
options.D: A role is uniquely associated with only one person, however an IAM user is intended to be assumable by anyone who needs it.
options.E: An IAM user has temporary credentials associated with it, however a role has permanent credentials associated with it.

explanation: An IAM user is a permanent identity associated with one person and has long-term credentials (password, access keys), while an IAM role provides temporary credentials and can be assumed by anyone or any service that needs it.

question: Which of the following actions may reduce Amazon EBS costs? (Choose TWO)

options.D: Changing the type of the volume.

explanation: Deleting unnecessary EBS snapshots removes storage costs for backups you no longer need, and changing volume types (e.g., from io2 to gp3) can reduce costs when high-performance IOPS are not required.

question: What does Amazon GuardDuty do to protect AWS accounts and workloads?

options.A: Notifies AWS customers about abuse events once they are reported.
options.B: Continuously monitors AWS infrastructure and helps detect threats such as attacker reconnaissance or account compromise.
options.C: Helps AWS customers identify the root cause of potential security issues.
options.D: Checks security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access to AWS. resources.

explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors your AWS accounts and workloads, using machine learning and threat intelligence to identify suspicious activity like attacker reconnaissance or compromised instances.

question: Which database service should you use if your application and data schema require "joins" or complex transactions?
explanation: Amazon RDS is a managed relational database service that supports SQL queries including joins and complex transactions (ACID), making it the right choice for applications with structured, relational data schemas.

question: Which of the following makes it easier for you to categorize, manage and filter your resources?
explanation: AWS tags are key-value metadata pairs that you attach to resources, making it easy to categorize, filter, search, and manage resources by project, environment, owner, or any other custom criteria.

question: What should you consider when storing data in Amazon Glacier?

options.A: Amazon Glacier only accepts data in a compressed format.
options.B: Glacier can only be used to store frequently accessed data and data archives.
options.C: Amazon Glacier does not provide immediate retrieval of data.
options.D: Attach Glacier to an EC2 Instance to be able to store data.

explanation: Amazon S3 Glacier is designed for archival storage and does not provide immediate data retrieval. Retrieval times range from minutes to hours depending on the retrieval option selected.

question: Engineers are wasting a lot of time and effort managing batch computing software in traditional data centers. Which of the following AWS services allows them to easily run thousands of batch computing jobs?
explanation: AWS Batch automatically provisions the optimal quantity and type of compute resources based on the volume and requirements of your batch jobs, removing the need to manage batch computing infrastructure manually.

question: How can you increase your application’s fault-tolerance while it is being hosted in AWS?

options.A: Deploy your application across multiple EC2 instances.
options.B: Deploy your application across multiple Availability Zones.
options.C: Host your application on one powerful EC2 instance type instead of multiple smaller instances.
options.D: Deploy the underlying application resources across multiple subnets.

explanation: Deploying across multiple Availability Zones ensures that if one AZ experiences a failure, your application continues running in another, providing fault tolerance through geographic redundancy within a Region.

question: Which of the following AWS Support Plans gives you 24/7 access to Cloud Support Engineers via email & phone? (Choose TWO)
explanation: The Business and Enterprise Support plans both provide 24/7 access to Cloud Support Engineers via phone, email, and chat. Developer Support only offers email access during business hours.

question: Which of the following requires an access key ID and a secret access key to get long-lived programmatic access to AWS resources? (Choose TWO)
explanation: IAM users and the AWS root user account can both have access key IDs and secret access keys for long-lived programmatic access. IAM roles use temporary credentials, and IAM groups cannot have access keys.

question: Which of the following is a benefit of the "Loose Coupling" architecture principle?

options.A: It eliminates the need for change management.
options.C: It helps AWS customers reduce Privileged Access to AWS resources.
options.D: It allows individual application components or services to be modified without affecting other components.

explanation: Loose coupling allows individual components to be modified, updated, or replaced independently without affecting other parts of the system, enabling faster development cycles and more resilient architectures.

question: A company needs to host a big data application on AWS using EC2 instances. Which of the following AWS Storage services would they choose to automatically get high throughput to multiple compute nodes?
explanation: Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) provides a shared NFS file system that automatically scales and delivers high throughput to multiple EC2 instances concurrently, ideal for big data workloads needing parallel access.

question: Which of the following Cloud Computing deployment models eliminates the need to run and maintain physical data centers?
explanation: The cloud deployment model eliminates the need to run and maintain physical data centers entirely, as all infrastructure is hosted and managed by the cloud provider in their facilities.

question: What are the benefits of the AWS Marketplace service? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Protects customers by performing periodic security checks on listed products.
options.C: Provides cheaper options for purchasing Amazon EC2 on-demand instances.
options.D: Provides flexible pricing options that suit most customer needs.
options.E: Provides software solutions that run on AWS or any other Cloud vendor.

explanation: AWS Marketplace offers flexible pricing options (hourly, monthly, annual, BYOL) and provides software solutions that can run on AWS or other cloud platforms, giving customers choice and cost flexibility.

question: What is the benefit of Amazon EBS volumes being automatically replicated within the same availability zone?
explanation: Amazon EBS volumes are automatically replicated within their Availability Zone to protect against hardware failures, providing durability by ensuring that data survives individual component failures.

question: You are planning to launch an advertising campaign over the coming weekend to promote a new digital product. It is expected that there will be heavy spikes in load during the campaign period, and you can’t afford any downtime. You need additional compute resources to handle the additional load. What is the most cost-effective EC2 instance purchasing option for this job?
explanation: On-Demand Instances are the best choice for short-term, unpredictable workloads where downtime is unacceptable. Spot Instances can be interrupted, and Reserved Instances require long-term commitments that don't suit a weekend campaign.

question: Which of the following AWS services integrates with AWS Shield and AWS Web Application Firewall (AWS WAF) to protect against network and application layer DDoS attacks?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront integrates natively with AWS Shield (for DDoS protection) and AWS WAF (for application-layer filtering), providing a layered defense against both network and application layer attacks at the edge.

question: Which of the following services is used when encrypting EBS volumes?
explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) manages the encryption keys used to encrypt EBS volumes. When you enable EBS encryption, KMS generates and controls the data encryption keys.

question: The AWS account administrator of your company has been fired. With the permissions granted to him as an administrator, he was able to create multiple IAM user accounts and access keys. Additionally, you are not sure whether he has access to the AWS root account or not. What should you do immediately to protect your AWS infrastructure? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Download all the attached policies in a safe place.
options.B: Delete all IAM accounts and recreate them.
options.C: Use the CloudWatch service to check all API calls that have been made in your account since the administrator was fired.
options.E: Change the email address and password of the root user account and enable MFA.

explanation: Immediately rotate all access keys to invalidate any keys the former administrator may have copied, and change the root account email and password with MFA enabled to prevent root-level access.

question: What is the Amazon ElastiCache service used for? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Provide an in-memory data storage service.
options.B: Reduce delivery costs using Edge Locations.
options.D: Provide a Chef-compatible cache to speed up application response.

explanation: Amazon ElastiCache provides an in-memory data store (Redis or Memcached) that caches frequently accessed data, dramatically improving web application performance by reducing database query latency.

question: The elasticity of the AWS Cloud enables customers to save costs when compared to traditional hosting providers. What can AWS customers do to benefit from the elasticity of the AWS Cloud? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Deploy your resources across multiple Availability Zones.
options.C: Deploy your resources in another region.

explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts instance counts based on demand to avoid paying for idle capacity, and serverless computing (Lambda, Fargate) charges only for actual execution time, both leveraging cloud elasticity for cost savings.

question: What are some of the benefits of using On-Demand EC2 instances? (Choose TWO)

options.A: They provide free capacity when testing your new applications.
options.B: They are cheaper than all other EC2 options.
options.C: They remove the need to buy “safety net” capacity to handle periodic traffic spikes.
options.D: They only require 1-2 days for setup and configuration.
options.E: You can increase or decrease your compute capacity depending on the demands of your application.

explanation: On-Demand Instances eliminate the need to pre-purchase capacity for traffic spikes, and let you increase or decrease compute capacity instantly based on application demand, with no long-term commitments.

question: Each AWS Region is composed of multiple Availability Zones. Which of the following best describes what an Availability Zone is?

options.A: It is a data center designed to be completely isolated from other data centers in the same region.
options.B: It is a collection of data centers distributed in multiple countries.
options.C: It is a logically isolated network of the AWS Cloud.
options.D: It is a distinct location within a region that is insulated from « failures in other Availability Zones.

explanation: An Availability Zone is a distinct location within a Region consisting of one or more data centers, designed to be isolated from failures in other AZs through independent power, cooling, and networking.

question: AWS provides disaster recovery capability by allowing customers to deploy infrastructure into multiple [...].
explanation: AWS Regions are geographically separate locations around the world. Deploying infrastructure across multiple Regions provides disaster recovery by ensuring operations continue even if an entire Region is affected.

question: A financial services company decides to migrate one of its applications to AWS. The application deals with sensitive data, such as credit card information, and must run on a PCI-compliant environment. Which of the following is the company’s responsibility when building a PCI-compliant environment in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Start the migration process immediately as all AWS services are PCI compliant.
options.B: Ensure that AWS services are configured properly to meet all PCI DSS standards.
options.C: Restrict any access to cardholder data and create a policy that addresses information security for all personnel.
options.D: Configure the underlying infrastructure of AWS services to meet all PCI DSS requirements.
options.E: Ensure that all PCI DSS physical security requirements are met.

explanation: Customers are responsible for ensuring AWS services are configured to meet PCI DSS standards and for restricting access to cardholder data with appropriate security policies. AWS manages the underlying infrastructure compliance.

question: What is the maximum amount of data that can be stored in S3 in a single AWS account?
explanation: Amazon S3 provides virtually unlimited storage capacity. There is no maximum limit on the total amount of data you can store in S3, though individual objects are limited to 5 TB each.

question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework provides recommendations to help customers select the right compute resources based on workload requirements?
explanation: The Performance Efficiency pillar of the Well-Architected Framework focuses on selecting the right resource types and sizes based on workload requirements to use computing resources efficiently.

question: Which AWS service delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency and high transfer speeds?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a global content delivery network (CDN) that delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users worldwide with low latency and high transfer speeds through a network of edge locations.

question: Which of the following steps should be taken by a customer when conducting penetration testing on AWS?

options.A: Conduct penetration testing using Amazon Inspector, and then notify AWS support.
options.B: Request and wait for approval from the customer’s internal security team, and then conduct testing.
options.C: Notify AWS support, and then conduct testing immediately.
options.D: Request and wait for approval from AWS support, and then conduct testing.

explanation: Since 2019, AWS allows customers to perform penetration testing on permitted services (EC2, RDS, Aurora, CloudFront, API Gateway, Lambda, Lightsail, Elastic Beanstalk) without prior AWS approval. Customers should follow their own internal security review processes before conducting tests.

question: Which AWS Cost Management tool allows you to view the most granular data about your AWS bill?
explanation: The AWS Cost and Usage Report provides the most granular billing data available, breaking down costs by hour, service, resource ID, and tags for detailed cost analysis and auditing.

question: Which element of the AWS global infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers each with redundant power networking and connectivity which are housed in separate facilities?
explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, housed in separate facilities within a Region.

question: How many Availability Zones should compute resources be provisioned across to achieve high availability?

options.D: A minimum of four or more.

explanation: A minimum of two Availability Zones is required for high availability, ensuring that if one AZ fails, the application continues operating from the other with minimal disruption.

question: The AWS Cloud’s multiple Regions are an example of:
explanation: AWS Regions spread across the globe are part of the AWS global infrastructure, which includes Regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations designed to deliver services worldwide.

question: Which AWS service can be used to manually launch instances based on resource requirements?
explanation: Amazon EC2 lets you manually launch virtual server instances with your choice of instance type, operating system, and configuration, providing full control over compute resource provisioning.

question: Which is a recommended pattern for designing a highly available architecture on AWS?

options.A: Ensure that components have low-latency network connectivity.
options.B: Run enough Amazon EC2 instances to operate at peak load.
options.C: Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component.
options.D: Use a monolithic application that handles all operations.

explanation: Designing for failure means building your application to gracefully handle the loss of any single component, using redundancy, health checks, and automatic failover to maintain availability.

question: Which AWS characteristics make AWS cost effective for a workload with dynamic user demand? (Select TWO)
explanation: Elasticity lets you automatically scale resources up or down with demand, and pay-as-you-go pricing ensures you only pay for what you actually use, making both ideal for workloads with unpredictable, dynamic demand.

question: An administrator needs to rapidly deploy a popular IT solution and start using it immediately. Where can the administrator find assistance?
explanation: AWS Quick Start reference deployments provide automated, gold-standard templates that deploy popular IT solutions on AWS in minutes, following AWS best practices for security and availability.

question: What is one of the advantages of the Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?

options.A: It simplifies relational database administration tasks.
options.C: It automatically scales databases for loads.
options.D: It enables users to dynamically adjust CPU and RAM resources.

explanation: Amazon RDS simplifies relational database administration by automating time-consuming tasks like hardware provisioning, database setup, patching, and backups, letting you focus on application development.

question: Which of the following AWS Cloud services can be used to run a customer-managed relational database?
explanation: Amazon EC2 provides virtual servers with full OS-level access, allowing you to install and manage any relational database software yourself, giving you complete control over the database configuration.

question: A user is planning to launch two additional Amazon EC2 instances to increase availability. Which action should the user take?

options.A: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.
options.B: Launch the instances as EC2 Reserved Instances in the same AWS Region and the same Availability Zone.
options.C: Launch the instances in multiple AWS Regions but in the same Availability Zone.
options.D: Launch the instances as EC2 Spot Instances in the same AWS Region but in different Availability Zones.

explanation: Launching instances across multiple Availability Zones within a single Region provides high availability by ensuring that if one AZ experiences a failure, the instances in other AZs continue serving traffic.

question: Which of the following can limit Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket access to specific users?

options.C: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.

explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies define permissions that control which users or roles can access specific S3 buckets and objects, providing fine-grained access control.

question: Which AWS service allows companies to connect an Amazon VPC to an on-premises data center? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS VPN creates an encrypted connection over the public internet, and AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network connection. Both enable secure connectivity between an Amazon VPC and an on-premises data center.

question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to monitor CPU usage?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects and monitors CPU utilization metrics from EC2 instances by default, and can trigger alarms or display dashboards when usage exceeds defined thresholds.

question: Which task is AWS responsible for in the shared responsibility model for security and compliance?

options.A: Granting access to individuals and services.

explanation: Updating the host firmware on EC2 physical servers is AWS's responsibility under the Shared Responsibility Model. Customers are responsible for their own OS updates, data encryption, and access management.

question: Which of the following security-related actions are available at no cost?

options.B: Contacting AWS Professional Services to request a workshop.
options.D: Attending AWS classes at a local university.

explanation: AWS forums, blogs, and whitepapers are publicly available security resources that anyone can access at no cost, providing guidance on best practices, architecture, and security configurations.

question: Which storage service can be used as a low-cost option for hosting static websites?
explanation: Amazon S3 can host static websites by serving HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and media files directly via HTTP, offering a low-cost, highly durable, and scalable solution without needing a web server.

question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model what is the sole responsibility of AWS?
explanation: Managing edge locations (the physical infrastructure used by CloudFront and other services) is solely AWS's responsibility. Patch management is shared, and application security and client-side data are the customer's responsibility.

question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select TWO)
explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework has six pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, and Sustainability. Performance Efficiency and Security are two of them.

question: Which AWS service identifies security groups that allow unrestricted access to a user’s AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks your security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access (0.0.0.0/0) to specific ports, flagging potential security risks in its Security category.

question: Which design principles for cloud architecture are recommended when re-architecting a large monolithic application? (Select TWO)
explanation: When re-architecting a monolith, implementing loose coupling breaks the application into independent components, and designing for scalability ensures each component can scale independently based on demand.

question: When architecting cloud applications, which of the following are a key design principle?
explanation: Elasticity is a key cloud design principle that means automatically scaling compute resources up or down based on demand, avoiding over-provisioning and reducing costs.

question: A company has deployed several relational databases on Amazon EC2 instances. Every month the database software vendor releases new security patches that need to be applied to the databases. What is the MOST efficient way to apply the security patches?

options.A: Connect to each database instance on a monthly basis and download and apply the necessary security patches from the vendor.
options.B: Enable automate patching for the instances using the Amazon RDS console.
options.C: In AWS Config. configure a rule for the instances and the required patch level.
options.D: Use AWS Systems Manager to automate database patching according to a schedule.

explanation: AWS Systems Manager Patch Manager automates the process of patching managed instances with security-related updates on a defined schedule, eliminating the need for manual patching of each database instance.

question: Which mechanism allows developers to access AWS services from application code?
explanation: The AWS Software Development Kit (SDK) provides language-specific APIs that allow developers to interact with AWS services directly from their application code in languages like Python, Java, Node.js, and .NET.

question: Which AWS feature will reduce the customer’s total cost of ownership (TCO)?
explanation: Elastic computing allows customers to scale resources up or down based on actual demand, eliminating the need to invest in peak-capacity hardware that sits idle most of the time, directly reducing TCO.

question: Which of the following is a benefit of using the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Permissive security removes the administrative burden.
options.B: Ability to focus on revenue-generating activities.
options.D: Choice of specific cloud hardware vendors.

explanation: AWS lets companies offload infrastructure management so they can focus on revenue-generating activities like product development and customer engagement, rather than spending time on data center operations.

question: Which of the following are categories of AWS Trusted Advisor? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations across five categories: Cost Optimization, Performance, Security, Fault Tolerance, and Service Limits. Fault Tolerance and Performance are two of them.

question: What is Amazon CloudWatch?

options.A: A code repository with customizable build and team commit features.
options.B: A metrics repository with customizable notification thresholds and channels.
options.C: A security configuration repository with threat analytics.
options.D: A rule repository of a web application firewall with automated vulnerability prevention features.

explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service that acts as a metrics repository, collecting performance and operational data from AWS resources and allowing you to set customizable notification thresholds and alarm channels.

question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following activities are the customer’s responsibility? (Select TWO)

options.A: Patching operating system components for Amazon Relational Database Server (Amazon RDS).
options.E: Maintaining environmental controls within a data center.

explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting data on the client side before sending it to AWS, and for configuring Network ACLs to control inbound and outbound traffic at the subnet level in their VPC.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is a shared control between a customer and AWS?
explanation: Patch management is a shared control: AWS patches the underlying infrastructure and managed service platforms, while customers patch their own guest operating systems and applications.

question: Which AWS service is used to pay AWS bills, and monitor usage and budget costs?
explanation: AWS Billing and Cost Management is the central service for paying AWS bills, monitoring usage, and managing budgets, providing dashboards and reports for comprehensive cost visibility.

question: How do customers benefit from Amazon’s massive economies of scale?

options.A: Periodic price reductions as the result of Amazon’s operational efficiencies.
options.B: New Amazon EC2 instance types providing the latest hardware.
options.C: The ability to scale up and down when needed.
options.D: Increased reliability in the underlying hardware of Amazon EC2 instances.

explanation: AWS achieves massive economies of scale by aggregating usage across hundreds of thousands of customers, and passes those savings to customers through periodic price reductions on AWS services.

question: Which AWS feature allows a company to take advantage of usage tiers for services across multiple member accounts?
explanation: Consolidated billing through AWS Organizations combines usage across all member accounts, allowing the organization to reach higher volume pricing tiers and unlock discounts that individual accounts could not achieve alone.

question: Which AWS services provide a way to extend an on-premises architecture to the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway extends on-premises storage to the cloud via standard protocols, and AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network link between on-premises infrastructure and AWS, both enabling hybrid architectures.

question: Which of the following services will automatically scale with an expected increase in web traffic?
explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically scales its request handling capacity in response to incoming application traffic, distributing requests across healthy targets without manual intervention.

question: Which service provides a virtually unlimited amount of online highly durable object storage?
explanation: Amazon S3 provides virtually unlimited, highly durable object storage with 99.999999999% (11 nines) durability, designed for storing and retrieving any amount of data from anywhere on the web.

question: Which AWS feature should a customer leverage to achieve high availability of an application?
explanation: Availability Zones are physically separate locations within a Region with independent infrastructure. Deploying across multiple AZs ensures your application remains available even if one zone fails.

question: Which AWS service or feature can enhance network security by blocking requests from a particular network for a web application on AWS? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS WAF lets you create rules to block requests from specific IP addresses or networks at the application layer, and Network ACLs provide stateless traffic filtering at the subnet level to block network-layer traffic.

question: Which of the following is a cloud architectural design principle?
explanation: Loosely coupling components means designing them to interact through well-defined interfaces (like queues or APIs) so that changes or failures in one component do not directly impact others.

question: Which service enables risk auditing by continuously monitoring and logging account activity, including user actions in the AWS Management Console and AWS SDKs?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail continuously logs all account activity and API calls across your AWS infrastructure, providing an audit trail that supports risk auditing, compliance monitoring, and security analysis.

question: Where can AWS compliance and certification reports be downloaded?
explanation: AWS Artifact is the self-service portal where customers can download AWS compliance and certification reports, including SOC, PCI, ISO, and other auditor-issued documents.

question: The financial benefits of using AWS are: (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS reduces Total Cost of Ownership by eliminating data center capital expenses, and reduces operational expenditure through pay-as-you-go pricing and managed services that lower staffing and maintenance costs.

question: Which AWS service can serve a static website?
explanation: Amazon S3 can serve static websites by hosting HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and image files, delivering them directly via HTTP without needing to run a web server.

question: What are the benefits of using the AWS Cloud for companies with customers in many countries around the world (Select TWO)

options.A: Companies can deploy applications in multiple AWS Regions to reduce latency.
options.B: Amazon Translate automatically translates third-party website interfaces into multiple languages.
options.C: Amazon CloudFront has multiple edge locations around the world to reduce latency.
options.D: Amazon Comprehend allows users to build applications that can respond to user requests in many languages.
options.E: Elastic Load Balancing can distribute application web traffic to multiple AWS Regions around the world which reduces latency.

explanation: Deploying applications in multiple AWS Regions places resources closer to users in different countries, and Amazon CloudFront's global edge locations cache content near end users, both reducing latency for international customers.

question: Which of the following are main components of the AWS global infrastructure? (Select TWO)
explanation: Regions and Availability Zones are the two main building blocks of the AWS global infrastructure. Regions are geographic areas, and each Region contains multiple isolated Availability Zones.

question: What is the AWS customer responsible for according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, data encryption is the customer's responsibility. Customers choose how and whether to encrypt their data at rest and in transit using AWS-provided tools or their own.

question: If each department within a company has its own AWS account, what is one way to enable consolidated billing?

options.A: Use AWS Budgets on each account to pay only to budget.
options.B: Contact AWS Support for a monthly bill.
options.C: Create an AWS Organization from the payer account and invite the other accounts to join.
options.D: Put all invoices into one Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, load data into Amazon Redshift, and then run a billing report.

explanation: Creating an AWS Organization from the payer (management) account and inviting other accounts to join enables consolidated billing, combining all accounts' usage into a single bill with potential volume discounts.

question: What costs are included when comparing AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) with on-premises TCO?
explanation: On-premises TCO includes data center security costs (guards, access controls, surveillance) that are eliminated when moving to AWS, where physical security is AWS's responsibility.

question: Which services can be used across hybrid AWS Cloud architectures? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon Route 53 provides DNS services that work across cloud and on-premises environments, and a Virtual Private Gateway enables encrypted VPN connections between your VPC and on-premises data center.

question: Which statement best describes Elastic Load Balancing?

options.A: It translates a domain name into an IP address using DNC.
options.B: It distributes incoming application traffic across one or more Amazon EC2 instances.
options.C: It collects metrics on connected Amazon EC2 instances.
options.D: It automatically adjusts the number of Amazon EC2 instances to support incoming traffic.

explanation: Elastic Load Balancing distributes incoming application traffic across multiple EC2 instances or targets, improving availability and fault tolerance by ensuring no single instance is overwhelmed.

question: Which of the following is a fast and reliable NoSQL database service?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database that delivers single-digit millisecond performance at any scale, with built-in security, backup, and in-memory caching.

question: Which AWS service would you use to obtain compliance reports and certificates?
explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports and certifications, including SOC, PCI DSS, ISO, and HIPAA documents, available directly from the AWS Management Console.

question: Which AWS services are defined as global instead of regional? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a global DNS service not tied to any specific Region, and Amazon CloudFront is a global CDN that operates from edge locations worldwide. Both function as global services.

question: How would an AWS customer easily apply common access controls to a large set of users?

options.A: Apply an IAM policy to an IAM group.
options.B: Apply an IAM policy to an IAM role.
options.C: Apply the same IAM policy to all IAM users with access to the same workload.
options.D: Apply an IAM policy to an Amazon Cognito user pool.

explanation: Attaching an IAM policy to an IAM group applies those permissions to all users in the group at once, making it the easiest way to manage common access controls for a large set of users.

question: Which of the following is an important architectural design principle when designing cloud applications?
explanation: Using multiple Availability Zones is a fundamental architectural principle that ensures high availability by protecting your application against the failure of any single data center or zone.

question: Which service allows a company with multiple AWS accounts to combine its usage to obtain volume discounts?
explanation: AWS Organizations with consolidated billing combines usage across all member accounts, allowing the organization to qualify for volume discounts based on aggregate consumption across services like S3 and EC2.

question: What is the benefit of using AWS managed services, such as Amazon ElastiCache and Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?

options.A: They require the customer to monitor and replace failing instances.
options.B: They have better performance than customer-managed services.
options.C: They simplify patching and updating underlying OSs.
options.D: They do not require the customer to optimize instance type or size selections.

explanation: AWS managed services like Amazon ElastiCache and Amazon RDS handle patching and updating the underlying operating systems and database engines, freeing customers from these time-consuming maintenance tasks.

question: What AWS team assists customers with accelerating cloud adoption through paid engagements in any of several specialty practice area ?
explanation: AWS Professional Services is a team of experts that assists customers through paid engagements in specialty areas like migration, cloud adoption strategy, and architecture optimization.

question: Which of the following inspects AWS environments to find opportunities that can save money for users and also improve system performance ?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and provides actionable recommendations to save money, improve performance, close security gaps, and improve fault tolerance.

question: Which of the following Amazon EC2 pricing models allow customers to use existing server-bound software license ?
explanation: EC2 Dedicated Hosts provide physical servers dedicated to your use, allowing you to use your existing server-bound software licenses (like Windows Server or SQL Server) that require per-socket or per-core licensing.

question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon S3? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon S3 is an object store that provides highly durable storage (99.999999999% durability). It stores data as objects in buckets, not as files in a file system or blocks on a disk.

question: Which services can be used across hybrid AWS Cloud architectures? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon Route 53 provides DNS services that work across both cloud and on-premises environments. A Virtual Private Gateway creates a secure VPN tunnel between your VPC and on-premises network for hybrid architectures.

question: Which AWS tools assist with estimating costs? (Select three.)

options.D: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

explanation: Cost allocation tags categorize and track AWS spending; the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator (now AWS Pricing Calculator) estimates monthly costs for planned workloads; and the AWS TCO Calculator compares on-premises vs. cloud costs. All three assist with estimating or understanding costs.

question: Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing? (Select TWO.)

options.A: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts
options.B: Service limits increasing by default in all accounts
options.C: A fixed discount on the monthly bill
options.D: Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined
options.E: The automatic extension of the master account's AWS support plan to all accounts

explanation: Consolidated billing provides a single bill for all accounts in an AWS Organization, simplifying financial management, and aggregates usage across accounts to unlock potential volume discounts.

question: Which AWS feature will reduce the customer's total cost of ownership (TCO)?
explanation: Elastic computing lets you match resource capacity to actual demand, scaling up during peaks and down during lulls, which eliminates paying for idle infrastructure and directly reduces total cost of ownership.

question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following activities are the customer's responsibility? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Patching operating system components for Amazon Relational Database Server (Amazon RDS)
options.E: Maintaining environmental controls within a data center

explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting data on the client side before sending it to AWS, and for configuring Network ACLs to control traffic at the subnet level. AWS handles RDS OS patching, data center staffing, and environmental controls.

question: AWS supports which of the following methods to add security to Identity and Access Management (IAM) users? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds a second verification layer beyond passwords, and enforcing password strength and expiration policies ensures credentials meet minimum security standards. Both directly secure IAM user access.

question: Which AWS services should be used for read/write of constantly changing data? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon RDS provides managed relational databases optimized for transactional read/write workloads, and Amazon EFS provides shared file storage with low-latency access for constantly changing file data.

question: Which feature of the AWS Cloud will support an international company's requirement for low latency to all of its customers?
explanation: AWS's global reach — with Regions and edge locations spread worldwide — allows companies to deploy resources close to their international customers, directly reducing network latency.

question: Which of the following is the customer's responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, customers are responsible for patching the guest operating system and applications on their Amazon EC2 instances. AWS patches the underlying host infrastructure.

question: Which of the following are features of Amazon CloudWatch Logs? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Summaries by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)

explanation: Amazon CloudWatch Logs provides real-time monitoring of log data as it is ingested, and offers adjustable retention periods so you can control how long log data is stored based on your compliance and operational needs.

question: A customer is deploying a new application and needs to choose an AWS Region. Which of the following factors could influence the customer's decision? (Select TWO.)

options.B: The application's presentation in the local language
options.E: Proximity to the customer's office for on-site visits

explanation: Choosing a Region close to end users reduces network latency, and data sovereignty compliance requirements may mandate that data stays within specific geographic boundaries. Both directly influence Region selection.

question: A company is looking for a scalable data warehouse solution. Which of the following AWS solutions would meet the company's needs?
explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service optimized for complex analytical queries across large datasets using columnar storage and massively parallel processing.

question: Which of the following are valid ways for a customer to interact with AWS services? (Select TWO.)
explanation: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) allows command-based interaction with AWS services from a terminal, and AWS SDKs provide programmatic access from application code in multiple languages. Both are valid interaction methods.

question: The AWS Cloud's multiple Regions are an example of:
explanation: AWS Regions distributed across the globe are a core component of the AWS global infrastructure, providing customers with geographic diversity for deploying workloads close to their users.

question: Which of the following AWS services can be used to serve large amounts of online video content with the lowest possible latency? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon S3 stores video content with high durability, and Amazon CloudFront caches and delivers that content from edge locations worldwide with low latency. Together they serve large-scale online video efficiently.

question: Which of the following security-related services does AWS offer? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor performs automated security checks that identify configuration risks, and AWS provides data encryption services (KMS, S3 encryption, EBS encryption) to protect data at rest and in transit.

question: Which of the following services could be used to deploy an application to servers running on-premises? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS OpsWorks supports deploying applications to on-premises servers using Chef or Puppet, and AWS CodeDeploy automates deployments to both EC2 instances and on-premises servers through a unified deployment agent.

question: Which design principles for cloud architecture are recommended when re-architecting a large monolithic application? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Loose coupling reduces inter-component dependencies so failures don't cascade, and designing for scalability ensures each component can independently handle varying loads. Both are essential when breaking apart a monolith.

question: Which AWS service provides a customized view of the health of specific AWS services that power a customer's workloads running on AWS?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides personalized alerts and remediation guidance when AWS events may impact the specific resources powering your workloads, unlike the Service Health Dashboard which shows general service status.

question: Which of the following can an AWS customer use to launch a new Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS CloudFormation can provision RDS clusters through infrastructure-as-code templates, and the AWS Management Console provides a graphical interface for launching RDS clusters directly. Both are valid launch methods.

question: Which of the following security measures protect access to an AWS account? (Select TWO.)

options.B: Grant least privilege access to IAM users.
options.C: Create one IAM user and share with many developers and users.
options.E: Activate multi-factor authentication (MFA) for privileged users.

explanation: Granting least privilege access ensures IAM users only have the permissions they need, and enabling MFA for privileged users adds a second authentication factor, both significantly reducing the risk of unauthorized access.

question: Which of the following is a component of the shared responsibility model managed entirely by AWS?
explanation: Auditing physical data center assets — including hardware inventory, physical security checks, and facility inspections — is entirely AWS's responsibility. Customers never have access to AWS data centers.

question: Which options does AWS make available for customers who want to learn about security in the cloud in an instructor-led setting? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS Online Tech Talks provide live, instructor-led virtual sessions on AWS topics, and AWS Classroom Training offers structured, in-person or virtual instructor-led courses for hands-on cloud security learning.

question: Which of the following features can be configured through the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) Dashboard? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Security Groups and Subnets are both configured through the Amazon VPC Dashboard. Security Groups control instance-level traffic, and Subnets define IP address ranges within a VPC.

question: How do customers benefit from Amazon's massive economies of scale?

options.A: Periodic price reductions as the result of Amazon's operational efficiencies
options.B: New Amazon EC2 instance types providing the latest hardware
options.C: The ability to scale up and down when needed
options.D: Increased reliability in the underlying hardware of Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: AWS passes its operational efficiencies and massive purchasing power to customers through periodic price reductions, lowering the cost of cloud services as AWS's scale grows.

question: Which AWS services can be used to gather information about AWS account activity? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS CloudTrail records API calls and account activity for audit purposes, and Amazon CloudWatch monitors resource utilization and operational metrics. Together they provide comprehensive visibility into account activity.

question: Which of the following common IT tasks can AWS cover to free up company IT resources? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS handles patching database software for managed services like Amazon RDS, and automates database backups through built-in backup features, freeing up company IT staff to focus on business-specific tasks.

question: What can AWS edge locations be used for? (Select TWO.)

options.D: Reducing traffic on the server by caching responses
options.E: Sending notification messages to end users

explanation: AWS edge locations deliver cached content closer to end users via CloudFront, reducing latency, and they also reduce load on origin servers by serving cached responses directly from the edge.

question: Which AWS services are defined as global instead of regional? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a global DNS service that operates across all Regions, and Amazon CloudFront is a global CDN that distributes content from edge locations worldwide. Neither is tied to a specific Region.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the AWS customer? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Ensuring that application data is encrypted at rest
options.B: Ensuring that AWS NTP servers are set to the correct time
options.C: Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services
options.D: Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted
options.E: Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly

explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting application data at rest using AWS tools like KMS or S3 encryption, and for ensuring their personnel receive proper security training on using AWS services.

question: The financial benefits of using AWS are: (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS reduces Total Cost of Ownership by eliminating capital expenditure on hardware and facilities, and lowers operational expenditure through pay-as-you-go pricing and managed services that reduce staffing needs.

question: Which of the following is entirely the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.A: Patching of the guest operating system
options.D: Development of an IAM password policy

explanation: Physical and environmental controls — including data center security, cooling, fire suppression, and power management — are entirely AWS's responsibility under the Shared Responsibility Model.

question: Which AWS service provides alerts when an AWS event may impact a company's AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard sends proactive alerts when AWS events may impact your specific resources, providing relevant information and remediation guidance tailored to your account.

question: Which of the following are categories of AWS Trusted Advisor? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations across five categories: Cost Optimization, Performance, Security, Fault Tolerance, and Service Limits. Fault Tolerance and Performance are two of these categories.

question: Which of the following services falls under the responsibility of the customer to maintain operating system configuration, security patching, and networking?
explanation: Amazon EC2 gives customers full control over the operating system, requiring them to handle OS configuration, security patching, and networking. RDS, ElastiCache, and Fargate are managed services where AWS handles these tasks.

question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, what is the sole responsibility of AWS?
explanation: Managing edge locations — the physical infrastructure powering CloudFront and other global services — is solely AWS's responsibility. Customers have no access to or control over edge location infrastructure.

question: Which AWS IAM feature is used to associate a set of permissions with multiple users?
explanation: IAM Groups let you attach a set of permissions (via IAM policies) to the group, and all users in that group automatically inherit those permissions, simplifying access management for multiple users.

question: Which of the following are benefits of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
explanation: Elasticity allows you to automatically scale resources up and down based on demand, and agility enables rapid provisioning and experimentation. Both are core advantages of the AWS Cloud over traditional infrastructure.

question: Which of the following can a customer use to enable single sign-on (SSO) to the AWS Console?
explanation: AWS Directory Service integrates with Microsoft Active Directory, enabling single sign-on (SSO) to the AWS Management Console using existing corporate credentials without creating separate IAM users.

question: What are the multiple, isolated locations within an AWS Region that are connected by low-latency networks called?
explanation: Availability Zones are multiple, isolated locations within an AWS Region, each with independent power, cooling, and networking, connected to each other by low-latency links for high availability.

question: Which of the following benefits does the AWS Compliance program provide to AWS customers? (Choose two.)

options.A: It verifies that hosted workloads are automatically compliant with the controls of supported compliance frameworks.
options.B: AWS is responsible for the maintenance of common compliance framework documentation.
options.C: It assures customers that AWS is maintaining physical security and data protection.
options.D: It ensures the use of compliance frameworks that are being used by other cloud providers.
options.E: It will adopt new compliance frameworks as they become relevant to customer workloads.

explanation: The AWS Compliance program verifies that hosted workloads can meet the controls of supported compliance frameworks, and assures customers that AWS maintains physical security and data protection standards.

question: Which of the following services provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports?
explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand, self-service access to AWS compliance reports and certifications, including SOC, PCI DSS, ISO, and HIPAA documents, directly from the AWS Console.

question: As part of the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following operational controls do users fully inherit from AWS?
explanation: Security management of the data center is an operational control customers fully inherit from AWS. AWS handles all physical security — guards, surveillance, access controls — and customers benefit from this protection without any action. Patch management and configuration management are shared controls, while user and access management is the customer's responsibility.

question: When comparing AWS Cloud with on-premises Total Cost of Ownership, which expenses must be considered? (Choose two.)
explanation: TCO analysis must include physical hardware costs like storage hardware and physical servers that exist on-premises but are eliminated when moving to AWS, where infrastructure is a variable operational expense.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose two.)

options.A: Maintaining the underlying Amazon EC2 hardware.
options.B: Managing the VPC network access control lists.
options.C: Encrypting data in transit and at rest.
options.E: Deploying hardware in different Availability Zones.

explanation: Customers are responsible for managing VPC Network ACLs to control subnet-level traffic, and for encrypting data in transit and at rest. AWS handles the underlying hardware, including failed drives and AZ deployments.

question: Which scenarios represent the concept of elasticity on AWS? (Choose two.)

options.A: Scaling the number of Amazon EC2 instances based on traffic.
options.B: Resizing Amazon RDS instances as business needs change.
options.C: Automatically directing traffic to less-utilized Amazon EC2 instances.
options.D: Using AWS compliance documents to accelerate the compliance process.
options.E: Having the ability to create and govern environments using code.

explanation: Scaling EC2 instances based on traffic is a classic example of elasticity (horizontal scaling), and resizing RDS instances as needs change demonstrates elasticity through vertical scaling. Both adapt resources to match demand.

question: When is it beneficial for a company to use a Spot Instance?

options.A: When there is flexibility in when an application needs to run.
options.D: When an instance should not be stopped.

explanation: Spot Instances are ideal when there is flexibility in when an application needs to run, because they use spare EC2 capacity at steep discounts but can be interrupted with two minutes' notice.

question: A company is considering moving its on-premises data center to AWS. What factors should be included in doing a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) analysis? (Choose two.)

options.B: Power consumption of the data center
options.C: Labor costs to replace old servers

explanation: TCO analysis should include power consumption of the data center and labor costs to replace old servers, as these are significant on-premises expenses eliminated when migrating to AWS.

question: How does AWS charge for AWS Lambda?

options.A: Users bid on the maximum price they are willing to pay per hour.
options.B: Users choose a 1-, 3- or 5-year upfront payment term.
options.C: Users pay for the required permanent storage on a file system or in a database.
options.D: Users pay based on the number of requests and consumed compute resources.

explanation: AWS Lambda charges based on the number of requests and the compute resources consumed (measured in GB-seconds of execution time), with no charges when code is not running.

question: What function do security groups serve related Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance security?

options.A: Act as a virtual firewall for the Amazon EC2 instance.
options.B: Secure AWS user accounts with AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.
options.C: Provide DDoS protection with AWS Shield.
options.D: Use Amazon CloudFront to protect the Amazon EC2 instance.

explanation: Security groups act as a virtual firewall for EC2 instances, controlling inbound and outbound traffic at the instance level by evaluating rules based on protocol, port, and source/destination.

question: What will help a company perform a cost benefit analysis of migrating to the AWS Cloud?

options.B: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

explanation: The AWS TCO Calculator helps organizations compare the cost of running workloads on-premises versus on AWS, factoring in infrastructure, labor, and operational expenses for a comprehensive cost-benefit analysis.

question: Which of the following provides the ability to share the cost benefits of Reserved Instances across AWS accounts?

options.A: AWS Cost Explorer between AWS accounts
options.C: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) Reserved Instance Utilization Report
options.D: Amazon EC2 Instance Usage Report between AWS accounts

explanation: Linked accounts under consolidated billing in AWS Organizations automatically share Reserved Instance cost benefits across all accounts, allowing unused RI capacity in one account to be applied to matching usage in another.

question: A company has multiple AWS accounts and wants to simplify and consolidate its billing process. Which AWS service will achieve this?
explanation: AWS Organizations provides consolidated billing, combining multiple AWS accounts under a single payer account to simplify billing management and potentially unlock volume discounts.

question: A company is designing an application hosted in a single AWS Region serving end-users spread across the world. The company wants to provide the end-users low latency access to the application data. Which of the following services will help fulfill this requirement?

options.D: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) transfer acceleration

explanation: Amazon CloudFront caches application data at edge locations worldwide, serving content to end users from the nearest edge location to minimize latency, even when the application is hosted in a single Region.

question: Which of the following deployment models enables customers to fully trade their capital IT expenses for operational expenses?
explanation: The cloud deployment model fully replaces upfront capital expenditure on hardware and facilities with variable operational expenses based on actual usage, eliminating the need to own physical infrastructure.

question: How is asset management on AWS easier than asset management in a physical data center?

options.A: AWS provides a Configuration Management Database that users can maintain.
options.B: AWS performs infrastructure discovery scans on the customer's behalf.
options.C: Amazon EC2 automatically generates an asset report and places it in the customer's specified Amazon S3 bucket.
options.D: Users can gather asset metadata reliably with a few API calls.

explanation: On AWS, users can gather asset metadata reliably with a few API calls using services like AWS Config, Systems Manager, and the AWS CLI. This is far easier than physical data center asset management, which requires manual hardware inventory, tagging, and tracking.

question: What feature of Amazon RDS helps to create globally redundant databases?
explanation: Amazon RDS Cross-Region read replicas create copies of your database in other AWS Regions, providing globally redundant database access for disaster recovery and low-latency reads for international users.

question: Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to grant access only to the resources needed to perform a task is a concept known as:
explanation: Least privilege access means granting IAM users only the minimum permissions they need to perform their specific tasks, reducing the risk of accidental or intentional misuse of AWS resources.

question: Which methods can be used to identify AWS costs by departments? (Choose two.)

options.A: Enable multi-factor authentication for the AWS account root user.
options.B: Create separate accounts for each department.
options.D: Use tags to associate each instance with a particular department.

explanation: Creating separate AWS accounts per department isolates costs naturally, and applying tags to resources allows cost allocation and tracking by department within shared accounts. Both enable department-level cost identification.

question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, customer responsibilities include which one of the following?

options.A: Securing the hardware, software, facilities, and networks that run all products and services.
options.B: Providing certificates, reports, and other documentation directly to AWS customers under NDA.
options.C: Configuring the operating system, network, and firewall.
options.D: Obtaining industry certifications and independent third-party attestations.

explanation: Customers are responsible for configuring the operating system, network, and firewall settings on their EC2 instances. AWS handles the physical infrastructure, hardware, and global network.

question: Which managed AWS service provides real-time guidance on AWS security best practices?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides real-time guidance on AWS best practices across security, cost optimization, performance, fault tolerance, and service limits, including specific security recommendations.

question: Which feature adds elasticity to Amazon EC2 instances to handle the changing demand for workloads?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances based on demand conditions you define, adding elasticity by scaling out during peaks and scaling in during lulls.

question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for which aspects of security in the cloud? (Choose two.)
explanation: Customers are responsible for encryption management (choosing what to encrypt and managing keys) and firewall management (configuring security groups and NACLs). AWS manages the physical hardware and facilities.

question: Which AWS hybrid storage service enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use AWS Cloud storage through standard file-storage protocols?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway provides on-premises applications with seamless access to AWS cloud storage through standard protocols like NFS, SMB, and iSCSI, bridging hybrid storage environments.

question: What is a responsibility of AWS in the shared responsibility model?

options.A: Updating the network ACLs to block traffic to vulnerable ports.
options.B: Patching operating systems running on Amazon EC2 instances.
options.C: Updating the firmware on the underlying EC2 hosts.
options.D: Updating the security group rules to block traffic to the vulnerable ports.

explanation: Updating the firmware on the underlying EC2 host hardware is AWS's responsibility. Customers manage their own instances, including OS patching, network ACLs, and security group rules.

question: Which architectural principle is used when deploying an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance in Multiple Availability Zone mode?

options.C: Automate everything that can be automated.

explanation: Deploying RDS in Multi-AZ mode applies the design for failure principle by maintaining a synchronous standby replica in another AZ, automatically failing over if the primary becomes unavailable.

question: What does it mean to grant least privilege to AWS IAM users?

options.A: It is granting permissions to a single user only.
options.B: It is granting permissions using AWS IAM policies only.
options.C: It is granting AdministratorAccess policy permissions to trustworthy users.
options.D: It is granting only the permissions required to perform a given task.

explanation: Least privilege means granting only the permissions required to perform a specific task — no more, no less — minimizing the potential damage from compromised credentials or accidental actions.

question: What is a benefit of loose coupling as a principle of cloud architecture design?

options.B: It allows applications to have dependent workflows.
options.C: It prevents cascading failures between different components.
options.D: It allows companies to focus on their physical data center operations.

explanation: Loose coupling prevents cascading failures because components interact through well-defined interfaces (queues, APIs) rather than direct dependencies, so a failure in one component doesn't bring down others.

question: A director has been tasked with investigating hybrid cloud architecture. The company currently accesses AWS over the public internet. Which service will facilitate private hybrid connectivity?

options.A: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) NAT Gateway
options.C: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) Transfer Acceleration

explanation: AWS Direct Connect establishes a dedicated, private network connection from your on-premises data center to AWS, bypassing the public internet for more consistent performance and enhanced security in hybrid architectures.

question: A company's web application currently has tight dependencies on underlying components, so when one component fails the entire web application fails. Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?

options.A: Implementing elasticity, enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
options.B: Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
options.C: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
options.D: Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.

explanation: Decoupling components means isolating them so each can function independently. When one component fails, the others continue operating because they communicate through asynchronous interfaces like queues rather than direct calls.

question: How can a customer increase security to AWS account logons? (Choose two.)

options.C: Use Amazon Cognito to manage access

explanation: Enabling MFA adds a second authentication factor beyond passwords, and configuring a strong password policy enforces minimum complexity requirements. Both directly strengthen account logon security.

question: What AWS service would be used to centrally manage AWS access across multiple accounts?
explanation: AWS Organizations provides centralized management of multiple AWS accounts, including Service Control Policies (SCPs) that define permission guardrails across all member accounts from a single management account.

question: Which AWS service can a customer use to set up an alert notification when the account is approaching a particular dollar amount?
explanation: AWS Budgets lets you set custom spending thresholds and sends alert notifications via email or SNS when your actual or forecasted costs approach or exceed the defined dollar amount.

question: Which is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan that provides designated Technical Account Managers?
explanation: The Enterprise Support plan is the minimum tier that includes a designated Technical Account Manager (TAM) who provides proactive guidance and serves as your primary point of contact with AWS.

question: Which of the following is an AWS Well-Architected Framework design principle related to reliability?

options.A: Deployment to a single Availability Zone

explanation: The ability to recover from failure is a core design principle of the Reliability pillar, which focuses on ensuring workloads perform their intended function correctly and consistently, including automatic recovery mechanisms.

question: What is an advantage of using the AWS Cloud over a traditional on-premises solution?

options.A: Users do not have to guess about future capacity needs.
options.B: Users can utilize existing hardware contracts for purchases.
options.C: Users can fix costs no matter what their traffic is.
options.D: Users can avoid audits by using reports from AWS.

explanation: AWS eliminates the need to guess future capacity needs by providing on-demand scaling — you provision exactly what you need now and scale up or down in minutes as requirements change.

question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model is the MOST cost efficient for an uninterruptible workload that runs once a year for 24 hours?
explanation: On-Demand Instances are most cost-efficient for a short, uninterruptible workload that runs once a year, since there's no long-term commitment and Spot Instances risk interruption.

question: Which of the following services is a MySQL-compatible database that automatically grows storage as needed?

options.B: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for MySQL

explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible database that automatically grows storage in increments of 10 GB up to 128 TB, without requiring manual intervention or downtime for storage management.
